title: An Overview of Coca-Cola's Entrance Into web3
body:
## Overview

Coca-Cola has an active web3 presence, and the brand is making a point to consolidate customer online experiences with their proprietary Coca-Cola app. The brand has a strong web2 presence, with philanthropy being a consistent theme with their Coca-Cola GiveÂ® portal. Sustainability, sports partnerships, and mental health awareness are three consistent themes through Cokeâ€™s brand style and storytelling.

## Initiatives

***Coca-Cola app (web2)*:** Coca-Cola app is a customer loyalty program to â€˜unlock refreshing surprises and redeem rewardsâ€”all at your fingertipsâ€™. Customers primarily interact with Cokeâ€™s loyalty program through the *Coca-Cola* app for iOS/Android. Coca-Cola app offerings include scanning icons on Coca-Cola packaging to earn â€˜rewards and access personalized experiencesâ€™. Customers can create their own custom beverage mixes via Coca-Cola FreestyleÂ®, and can receive location-based rewards and offers at theaters and restaurants.

**Coca-Cola Insiders Club:** Insiderâ€™s Club was a box subscription service that Coca-Cola tested as a service from January 2021 to March 2021. Each box featured three new or limited edition products before they hit shelves nationwide. Swag, and â€˜exclusive virtual experiences with a celebrityâ€™ were included with every box each month. The membership was paid upfront, with a 3-month subscription costing $45 plus tax and included free shipping.

***The Friendship Box NFT*:** The Friendship Box NFT is Coca-Colaâ€™s first foray into NFT web3 culture. On July 30th, 2021, four unique Coca-Cola NFTs were up for auction as a single â€˜loot boxâ€™, for sale on Opensea.io. All proceeds for the sale went to Special Olympics International, a longtime partner of Coca-Cola. Auctioned as one lot, the collection features multi-sensory NFTs housed inside a â€˜Friendship Boxâ€™. Coca-Colaâ€™s Josh Schwarber explains, â€œThe metaverseâ€”which is borderless and â€˜geo-lessâ€™â€”creates opportunities to connect with others like never before. We didnâ€™t want to do this just to make an NFT. We wanted to inject the core principles of Coca-Cola and celebrate both our heritage and ties to friendship, while also doing something that hasnâ€™t been done before.â€

The Friendship Box acts as a dynamic loot box that contains the following:

* Physical: The winning bidder received a real-life SMEG FAB28 Coca-Cola fridge, stocked with ice-cold Coke.
* Digital: A custom-designed Coca-Cola Bubble jacket wearable, which included an unlockable version that can be worn in Decentraland. A Sound Visualizer NFT included the â€˜unmistakable fizz of a Cokeâ€™ complete with visual effects. Lastly, â€˜The Friendship Cardâ€™ refreshes 1948 artwork used in a set of Coca-Cola trading cards from the 1990s symbolizing friendship and refreshment. The metaverse-influenced iteration of the cards add motion, light and 3D features.

**Coca-Cola Snow Globes:** Coca-Cola partnered with VeVe (a popular digital collectable app) to release a collection of Christmas themed digital collectables. This drop included the classic Polar Bear, Coke Bottles, Neon Coca-Cola sign, and a singular Coke bottle. Each drop had a different list price, rarity level, and number of collectables available to purchase. VeVe is being used to simplify the process of purchasing and using NFTs.

**Coca-Cola Zero Sugar Byte:** Coca-Cola recently announced it is launching a gaming-inspired version of a virtual Coke beverage, surrounding the Coca-Cola Starlight release. The first video game it will be available in will be Fortnite. Coke has teamed up with gaming organization PWR to help with the creation of Pixel Point, a custom island built in Fortnite Creative. Fortnite Creative is a separate mode within Fortnite that allows companies and players to build their own custom worlds. Once players enter Pixel Point, they can try out coke-themed mini-games, as well as â€˜tryâ€™ the new drink flavors.

**The Coca-Cola Combo Burger Day Collection:** This International Burger Day (May 28th), Coca-Cola dropped more than 4000 free, unique digital collectables celebrating the classic combination of an ice-cold Coca-Cola and a burger hot off the grill. Every Coca-Cola combo comes in a mysterious red bag and inside each bag youâ€™ll find a generative burger with varying traits to satisfy every taste, and a classic bottle of Coca-Cola Zero that goes with every single one. This release was as floppy as a barely cooked burger, with virtually zero traction or interest from anyone.

**Coca-Cola Pride Collection**: The Coca-Cola Pride collection is a series of 136 digital collectibles made in celebration of the LGBTQIA+ community. The limited edition pieces feature an exclusive take on the iconic Coca-Cola bottle with artwork by Rich Mnisi, fashion designer and leading campaigner for LGBTQIA+ rights in South Africa. His commissioned design has been sliced into individual fragments and dispersed across all 136 collectibles, making each one unique. The collection aims to shine color-filled light on the LGBTQIA+ community's members and spread a message of Love. This collection was released on Polygon and currently has a low floor price and total volume.

![Four different ways how not to release a branded NFT collection](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/RSJZ07igKc1XkpGXT1qre.webp?height=767&width=767)

## POS System

Coca-Cola partnered with connectivity platform Omnivore to create a digital marketplace that makes it easier for customers to order Coke products through a Menu Management System (MMS) . MMS helps restaurant brands manage the complexity of numerous digital menus across online ordering, third-party apps, menu boards, kiosks, and more. MMS integrates the POS system, resulting in order injection, data collection, and control of content. This can allow for immediate pricing updates, deeper analytics, and easier surcharging.

USD is the only accepted currency on Coca-Colaâ€™s website for US customers. Coca-Colaâ€™s website allows for SSO via Google, Facebook, and Apple. The login for Coca-Colaâ€™s website is the same as the app. Payment methods include traditional credit cards, Google Pay, and Paypal.

## Metrics

Because of the lack of data available from Coca-Colaâ€™s NFT launches, Openseaâ€™s Price History was used in favor of Dune.xyz. These metrics are included below. The metrics for more recent collections were so unimpressive and low (sub 1ETH total volume) that making a dashboard for the collections seemed like a waste of time.

## Virtual/In-Person Events

* Coca-Cola has the World of Coca-Cola museum in Atlanta Georgia, showcasing the history of the company, as well as the Biedenharn Coca-Cola museum that serves as the original Coca-Cola bottling facility
* On International Friendship Day, Coca-Cola sponsored a â€˜can-topâ€™ party within Decentraland that was available for anyone, regardless of owning a particular NFT
* There have been no in-person events for NFT holders
* In 2022, Coca-Cola hopes to incorporate more digital experiences into their brand, with their â€˜Coca-Cola Starlightâ€™ digital collectables

## Brand Analysis

Strengths

* Has begun to embrace web3 and NFTs, using the latter as a way to promote its philanthropic ideals
* Released two different NFT collections on two separate platforms ([Opensea.io](http://Opensea.io) and VeVe), which garnered considerable hype online and generated more interest in NFTs from non-crypto consumers
* Hosted an event on Decentraland. Not NFT gated, but showing initiative and interest in the metaverse
* Is capitalizing on the nostalgic nature of the Coca-Cola brand, through NFTs and social media

Weaknesses

* Coke has made a greater effort than other soft drink brands to dabble in web3, but could be offering a lot more given the sheer breadth of the IP. Every single release has been a flop
* Needs a bigger tech team focused on NFTs and metaverse content to stay competitive and roll out new offerings quicker; Coke needs to stop releasing boring NFT collections
* There are little to no notable utilities associated with the NFTs offered, and the only notable NFT offered was sold at a price that is entirely unaffordable and unrealistic for the average consumer
* Little to no incorporation of the metaverse events or NFTs on the main website; no mention of web3 offerings on the Coca-Cola app
* IP is interested in web3 but at this point has invested very little and is cautious to invest more time and energy into the space

Opportunities

* Is easily one of the largest and most successful companies in the world, with a brand so recognizable it is hard to think of anything more cemented in American culture
* The first NFT launch was met with a ton of interest and bidding from ardent fans; Coca-Cola can recover from a poor launch in ways other brands cannot
* Digital brands are eager to partner with Coca-Cola, and the brand is being selective on how they proceed in the market

Threats

* The lack of a Coca-Cola Discord server means that any comparable competitor could beat them in the social media space just by appealing to younger audiences
* Other major soda brands could just as easily and quickly embrace web3. Nothing Coke has done is not replicable by other brands
* The success or failure of VeVe as the established and primary online platform for digital collectables could sway Coke from pursuing NFTs more seriously. VeVe was exploited in March of 2022, with the in-app token being acquired illegally by hackers. This has caused increased skepticism of the long-term viability of the VeVe platform
* Waiting for the right moment to embrace the metaverse more strongly just means another brand may take their place and gain popularity online-Repeated flops could turn long-term web3 investors away permanently

## Summary

Coca-Cola is a legendary brand that is beginning to embrace web3 and finding unique ways to incorporate it into its brand IP. Although Coke has been slow to roll-out new NFT and metaverse offerings, previous releases have been well received by the public and have not induced backlash. Coca-Cola Combo Burger Day and LGBTQIA+ releases were to practically zero fanfare, with some of the lowest floor prices seen for a major brand (consequently also on Polygon). The Coca-Cola app shows no signs of incorporating cryptocurrency or NFTs anytime soon, which could mean that full adoption for the brand is some time away. It is difficult to derive the metrics from Cokeâ€™s VeVe release, given the closed nature of the platform. With a solid IP and impressive annual gross profit, Coke can take the time it needs to decide how best to proceed in the web3 market.

## Overview

Coca-Cola has an active web3 presence, and the brand is making a point to consolidate customer online experiences with their proprietary Coca-Cola app. The brand has a strong web2 presence, with philanthropy being a consistent theme with their Coca-Cola GiveÂ® portal. Sustainability, sports partnerships, and mental health awareness are three consistent themes through Cokeâ€™s brand style and storytelling.

## Initiatives

***Coca-Cola app (web2)*:** Coca-Cola app is a customer loyalty program to â€˜unlock refreshing surprises and redeem rewardsâ€”all at your fingertipsâ€™. Customers primarily interact with Cokeâ€™s loyalty program through the *Coca-Cola* app for iOS/Android. Coca-Cola app offerings include scanning icons on Coca-Cola packaging to earn â€˜rewards and access personalized experiencesâ€™. Customers can create their own custom beverage mixes via Coca-Cola FreestyleÂ®, and can receive location-based rewards and offers at theaters and restaurants.

**Coca-Cola Insiders Club:** Insiderâ€™s Club was a box subscription service that Coca-Cola tested as a service from January 2021 to March 2021. Each box featured three new or limited edition products before they hit shelves nationwide. Swag, and â€˜exclusive virtual experiences with a celebrityâ€™ were included with every box each month. The membership was paid upfront, with a 3-month subscription costing $45 plus tax and included free shipping.

***The Friendship Box NFT*:** The Friendship Box NFT is Coca-Colaâ€™s first foray into NFT web3 culture. On July 30th, 2021, four unique Coca-Cola NFTs were up for auction as a single â€˜loot boxâ€™, for sale on Opensea.io. All proceeds for the sale went to Special Olympics International, a longtime partner of Coca-Cola. Auctioned as one lot, the collection features multi-sensory NFTs housed inside a â€˜Friendship Boxâ€™. Coca-Colaâ€™s Josh Schwarber explains, â€œThe metaverseâ€”which is borderless and â€˜geo-lessâ€™â€”creates opportunities to connect with others like never before. We didnâ€™t want to do this just to make an NFT. We wanted to inject the core principles of Coca-Cola and celebrate both our heritage and ties to friendship, while also doing something that hasnâ€™t been done before.â€

The Friendship Box acts as a dynamic loot box that contains the following:

* Physical: The winning bidder received a real-life SMEG FAB28 Coca-Cola fridge, stocked with ice-cold Coke.
* Digital: A custom-designed Coca-Cola Bubble jacket wearable, which included an unlockable version that can be worn in Decentraland. The metaverse-influenced iteration of the cards add motion, light and 3D features.

**Coca-Cola Snow Globes:** Coca-Cola partnered with VeVe (a popular digital collectable app) to release a collection of Christmas themed digital collectables. This drop included the classic Polar Bear, Coke Bottles, Neon Coca-Cola sign, and a singular Coke bottle. Each drop had a different list price, rarity level, and number of collectables available to purchase. VeVe is being used to simplify the process of purchasing and using NFTs.

**Coca-Cola Zero Sugar Byte:** Coca-Cola recently announced it is launching a gaming-inspired version of a virtual Coke beverage, surrounding the Coca-Cola Starlight release. The first video game it will be available in will be Fortnite. Coke has teamed up with gaming organization PWR to help with the creation of Pixel Point, a custom island built in Fortnite Creative. Fortnite Creative is a separate mode within Fortnite that allows companies and players to build their own custom worlds. Once players enter Pixel Point, they can try out coke-themed mini-games, as well as â€˜tryâ€™ the new drink flavors.

**The Coca-Cola Combo Burger Day Collection:** This International Burger Day (May 28th), Coca-Cola dropped more than 4000 free, unique digital collectables celebrating the classic combination of an ice-cold Coca-Cola and a burger hot off the grill. Every Coca-Cola combo comes in a mysterious red bag and inside each bag youâ€™ll find a generative burger with varying traits to satisfy every taste, and a classic bottle of Coca-Cola Zero that goes with every single one. This release was as floppy as a barely cooked burger, with virtually zero traction or interest from anyone.

**Coca-Cola Pride Collection**: The Coca-Cola Pride collection is a series of 136 digital collectibles made in celebration of the LGBTQIA+ community. The limited edition pieces feature an exclusive take on the iconic Coca-Cola bottle with artwork by Rich Mnisi, fashion designer and leading campaigner for LGBTQIA+ rights in South Africa. His commissioned design has been sliced into individual fragments and dispersed across all 136 collectibles, making each one unique. The collection aims to shine color-filled light on the LGBTQIA+ community's members and spread a message of Love. This collection was released on Polygon and currently has a low floor price and total volume.

![Four different ways how not to release a branded NFT collection](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/RSJZ07igKc1XkpGXT1qre.webp?height=767&width=767)

## POS System

Coca-Cola partnered with connectivity platform Omnivore to create a digital marketplace that makes it easier for customers to order Coke products through a Menu Management System (MMS) . MMS helps restaurant brands manage the complexity of numerous digital menus across online ordering, third-party apps, menu boards, kiosks, and more. MMS integrates the POS system, resulting in order injection, data collection, and control of content. This can allow for immediate pricing updates, deeper analytics, and easier surcharging.

USD is the only accepted currency on Coca-Colaâ€™s website for US customers. Coca-Colaâ€™s website allows for SSO via Google, Facebook, and Apple. The login for Coca-Colaâ€™s website is the same as the app. Payment methods include traditional credit cards, Google Pay, and Paypal.

 When it comes to classics, I think everyone is familiar with them. The book "Education of Love" is a classic. After reading this book, my heart was deeply shaken. Love, like air, surrounds us all the time; love is a golden key to open our hearts; love is the bridge of gratitude between people; love is a vivid life textbook... The storyline of the book "The Education of Love" moved me very much. It seemed to make me suddenly understand that love is so sacred and noble. Love includes many things, ranging from the love of the country, society, and nation, to the love of parents, teachers and students, friends, and some even to strangers. The book "Education of Love" expresses "love" incisively and vividly, and is gripping and touching everywhere. Every plot in the book can give us a philosophy of love, allowing us to have a deeper interpretation and understanding of love. There is such a story in this book: when he came to school, a first-grade pupil suddenly left his mother's hand and fell on the street. At this time, the car was coming towards him. Seeing that the child was about to be run over by the car, Lopedi jumped over boldly and dragged him out. . At this time, Mr. Principal came. Lopedi put his head on Mr. Headmaster's shoulder, his face was pale and his eyes were closed. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/bSWuzG8ayse5mG0STuV_t.png?height=700&width=525)

(www.lz13.cn) After a while, a lot of people have gathered here, and they said in unison: "Lopedi! How brave! Poor child!" Yes, isn't Lopeti's great spirit of giving up his life for others and sympathy for the weak and the unfortunate, not worth learning from? From this, I thought of myself. Today, I did "Have you been in love?" "Well, I did." In the morning, my mother gave me three yuan to go out for breakfast, and when I was walking on the road, I saw an old woman with shabby clothes and gray hair. He was begging for food with a bowl. I looked at her from a distance and saw the anxious, eager look in her eyes. I ran over without hesitation and handed the three yuan to the old woman, feeling a lot of relief. Although I didn't save a life like Lopedi did, at least the three yuan can solve the old woman's breakfast! Isn't that what "love" is in the world? It is like the scent of blooming jasmine flowers, bland but pleasant. Let's love, not only the relatives and friends around us, but also more people who need care waiting for us to love. Go love, as long as everyone gives a little love, the world will become a warm world! To love, as long as this sentence is our guide to action, the world will become gorgeous! Let's love, let's make an appointment with love, and make an appointment with famous novels!

## âœ¨Â |Data check|

### **State of Ethereum Ecosystem Q2, 2022**

As the crypto market enters a bear market cycle, usersâ€™ willingness to speculate has declined, and data such as block space requirements, active addresses, and DEX transaction volume have all declined. As the network transitions from proof-of-work (PoW) to proof-of-stake (PoS) in progress, the ETH staked on the beacon chain in the second quarter showed a growth trend; on the other hand, with the increasing popularity of PFP NFT, the average number of NFT daily active traders in the second quarter increased significantly, and the NFT transaction volume soaring, the "bear meme" led by Globlintown, has become the main driver of this round of NFT growth.

### **Ethereum Ecosystem Revenue Reports Q2, 2022**

* Protocol

  Ethereum network revenue dropped by 33.4% due to falling demand for block space. EIP-1559â€™s new fee burning mechanism reduced ETH inflation by 37%. Beacon chain staking increased by 177.5%, due to increased integrations of liquid staking derivatives(LSD) into different DeFi Protocols.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/dAk7D-rIHBC0kH1-7Z4UA.png?height=436&width=1520)

* DeFi Ecosystem

  The decline in user risk appetite caused DeFi TVL to drop by 42.4%. Stablecoin circulation supply increased by 43%, due to newly issued stablecoins, and increased trading or leverage demand. Perpetual DEX transactions increased by 598.5%, mainly coming from dYdX. Although the Luna incident and the market pressure brought about by the excessive leverage of institutions, Compound, Aave, and Maker have all withstood the test of liquidation, with a total liquidation of $460 million.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/smp-9iIZOyf3whZQJ50Dt.png?height=420&width=1434)

* NFT Ecosystem

  NFT market transaction volume soared 2439.2%, daily active users increased by 1114.5%, indicating increased PFP penetration; Bored Ape Yacht Club (BAYC) floor soared 3844% â€” from 2.50 ETH to 98.60 ETH.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/C9qNjtwpn6fLWbAsv6TEZ.png?height=366&width=1436)

* L2 Ecosystem

  TVL on L2 increased 896% from $374.17M to $3.72B. Arbitrum revenue hit $8.2M, while Optimism hit $5.58M.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/HMrmnGpYLnf_st-3nRQZi.png?height=366&width=1470)

title: Live happily in the moment
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/CkKpB6xHckFFs4ipRWRUe.png?height=270&width=336)

A friend bought a pen and paper and inkstone, and asked me to inscribe a few words for him to hang it on the living room of his new home to patch the wall. This made me feel a little embarrassed, because I knew that my handwriting was not good-looking, not to mention that I hadn't written calligraphy for many years.

My friend said, "What are you afraid of? I feel honored to hang your name. I am not afraid anymore. What are you afraid of?"

In front of my friends, I unfolded the paper, polished the ink, and wrote the words "I often think about one or two".

The friend said, "What does this mean?"

I said, "It means that my handwriting is not good. If you see this handwriting, please bear with me, think about one or two things that are good for me, and then forgive me."

Seeing my joking attitude, my friend said, "What do you mean by being serious?"

"As the saying goes, 'unsatisfactory things happen nine times out of ten', the unsatisfactory things in our life account for the vast majority, so living is painful. If we want to live a happy life, we must always think about the good things that one or two are, so that we will feel fortunate and know how to cherish them, and we will not be overwhelmed by the unsatisfactory.â€

When my friend heard it, he was very happy and went home with "Changing Thinking One or Two".

2

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/bHmXdME6kUAoHL0MreJ-p.png?height=294&width=391)

A few months later, he came to visit me and asked me for words again, saying: "I am tired and angry in the office every day, and I am very happy when I come home and see the picture of 'I often think about a thing or two'. But the walls are too big, and the words appear to be too large. Too small, you can write a few more words!"

For good friends, I have always been responsive to requests, so I wrote the second couplet "I don't think about eight or nine" for "I often think about one or two", and wrote a horizontal batch of "Ruyi" on it, and I drew a freehand vase of flowers in the middle.

Unexpectedly, after a few months, I was troubled by many bizarre legends and rumors. A friend called one day and said that he was sitting in front of the words I wrote in the living room, and he said, "I can't think of anything to comfort you, so I will read your own words to you: I often think about one or two, don't think about it. Eight or nine, everything goes well!"

When I received a call from a friend, I was very moved. I often feel that it is easy to add icing on the cake in other people's festivities, but it is very difficult to help others in the misery. Those who can't help in the snow are not true friends, let alone those who fall into the trap.

3

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/6FVHp2Nc-anERvaO2KFuS.png?height=430&width=304)

However, after a person reaches the age of forty, he has probably exercised the ability to "not be frightened by humiliation" in his life, and he will not care about the icing on the cake, the help in the snow, or the downfall. That is because we have already experienced the pain and setbacks of life, and we have also experienced many emotional encounters and separations, and we are slowly searching for positive, happy, and positive visualizations in our life. This kind of visualization is exactly the visualization of "often thinking one or two".

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/w2TIfwQEFjiZDJH5H9_44.png?height=430&width=304)

The visualization of "thinking about one or two often" is to look for a ray of dawn in the heavy dark clouds; it is to open up some quiet news in the rolling red dust; it is to surface when you are on the verge of suffocation, and there is a deep breath .

Life is already hard enough. If we add up the unsatisfactory events of fifty years, it will definitely make it difficult for us. Life and feelings are in misery, and sometimes it is helpless, but if even thoughts and feelings are in misery, it is asking for trouble and adding to the misery.

4

Since I was a child, I liked to read the biographies and memoirs of big people, and I slowly concluded a formula: all big people suffer, and their lives are almost the true testimony of "unhappy things in life", but when they face hardships They can also maintain positive thinking and can "think one or two often". Finally, they transcend suffering, and suffering becomes the most fertile nutrient for life.

What moved me was not their suffering, because suffering is everywhere; what moved me was their perseverance, optimism and courage in the face of suffering.

It turns out that "good luck" or "unsatisfactory" is not determined by the fate of life, but by the moment of thought.

It turns out that it is not "eight or nine" that determines the quality of life, but "one or two".

It turns out that suffering is measured in quantity for those who fall into it, but becomes quality for those who transcend. Quantity accumulates and quality activates.

Since the joys and sorrows of life are just processes, why should we give up our own thoughts to cater to each process?

Just live happily in the moment, let every moment be affectionate, righteous, glowing, and poetic!

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
body:
"The Count of Monte Cristo" Throughout the ages, there have been countless popular novels in the world, but there are very few excellent works. Among them, Alexandre Dumas' "The Count of Mount Chito" can be said to be one of the best. The number of readers he has is a testament to his worth, and there is no doubt that The Earl of Mount Keto is one of the great examples of popular fiction. There are as many as 100 Alexandre Dumas novels, most of which are based on the real history as the background and the adventures of the protagonist as the content. The unusual ideal hero, the dramatic development of the storyline, the tense fighting action, the clear and clear complete structure, the vivid and powerful language, the flexible and witty dialogue and so on constitute the characteristics of Dumas' novels. The story is about an innocent man who is deliberately framed and wrongly held, but he takes revenge on those who have betrayed him with a well-planned scheme. Edmund Dantes, an active young sailor, is an honest and honest young man. But his peaceful life and his plans to marry the beautiful Mercedes were suddenly disrupted. Because his best friend, Fernand, also wants to marry Mercedes and has been cheating on Dantes. This "good friend", in order to frame Dantes, devised a trap together with Tangeral, who had a grudge against Dantes, slandering his connection with Napoleon, so that Dantes was taken by the police at the wedding banquet. He was wrongfully tried by Judge Villefort, who imprisoned him in the infamous Prison of Ifo Castle on the Isle of Ifo Edmund Dantes lived there for thirteen years of nightmares. However, during the period, he met the same old priest Faria who was framed. He learned a lot from the priest and launched his own enemies. With the help of Faria, Dantes planned and successfully escaped from the prison. He found the treasure left to him by Faria, and became a mysterious and wealthy "Count of Monte Cristo". With his wit and ruthlessness, he subtly squeezed into the upper class of France. He repaid his benefactors and made those who had manipulated and enslaved him pay a huge price step by step. When the revenge was over, he raised his eyebrows. Yuanfan, left France forever! Speaking of the features of this work, I think there are four most important ones. The first is the plot twists and the arrangement is reasonable. Generally speaking, successful novel tutors have twists and turns in plots and ups and downs, and Chidushan's Enmity and Vengeance is exemplary in this regard, and the novel attracts the attention of readers as soon as the novel opens. Edmund has just returned, young and promising, ready to get married, and acting captain, and has a bright future. It was his enemy, Tangeral, who was jealous of him, so he joined hands with his rival in a play, causing Edmund to suffer miserably, while the prosecutor, Villefort, put him in prison for protecting his father. This dramatic opening officially sets the stage for what follows. Later, Edmund's description in the black prison is even more impressive, and it is one of the most exciting parts of the book. Later, he actually cheated with the dead and escaped from the black prison. At this point, the readers hold their breaths, applauding the author's fantastic idea. However, this is only a prelude. Later he got the treasure and became a billionaire, the name is Earl of Mount Kedo. After that, it was his revenge. The novel is mainly about revenge. Dumas' ingenuity lies in the fact that the three revenges are written differently, each with its own interest, but it is also related to the occupation and criminal nature of the three enemies. And the different outcomes of revenge keep the plot from being rigid, making people feel full of changes, and readers can't expect such an ending. After reading it, and thinking about it again, there is indeed no better ending, so I can't help but admire the author's clever arrangement. Alexandre Dumas was not satisfied with the bizarre twists and turns of the basic plot, because the length of the story was too long, and only such a simple plot would still appear monotonous, so he interspersed a lot of thrilling scenes, such as the green forest hero haunting near Rome, using the carnival The festival carried out kidnapping activities; Madame Villefort poisoned people for her property, and Caderousse entered the Count's house to steal at night... The danger survived, with the artistic effect of peaks, twists and turns, and ups and downs, but it was not detached from the theme, Influence Center. This kind of big story set with small stories is just right. Every episode is very exciting and compact, and it serves the theme. For example, the expedition on the island written in the middle seems to have nothing to do with the theme, but it is The enemy's child, Albert... It is these little stories that make the plot complex but not sloppy, and it is only exciting to read, not boring. The second artistic feature of Monte Cristo's Enmity and Enmity is that it is bizarre and melted into one furnace. The novel touches on a wide range of society, ranging from the court of Louis XVIII, to the feasting and feasting of the upper class, to the gloomy and dreadful prison and the dark psychology of the prisoners, the robbers of the green forest, and the poor life of the citizens. description. The novel is by no means a sweeping scan of all social classes, but a certain depth of portrayal. For example, when describing the court, the author wrote in a few strokes the characteristics of Louis XVIII himself and his court fashion and the high society reception is even more wonderful and appropriate. He is also unique in his description of the lower society. His detailed description shows the prison life that ordinary readers do not know. Even the description of the inmates' discourse shows that the author also understands the scum of these societies. (www.lz13.cn) In addition, Alexandre Dumas's exotic writing is also very wonderful. It is the organic combination of this colorful society and exotic local customs that shows Dumas's broad vision and romantic artistic taste in a fusion of skills. This feature is also closely related to the legend of the novel. The third artistic feature is: complete structure and rich language. The structure of Jidushan's Enmity and Vengeance is very clear. The first half is a wedge, and it is this wedge that leads to the subsequent plot of revenge. Although the subsequent revenge plot is three clues, but they intersect each other, the narrative is methodical, the writing is interlocking, and the steps are in-depth. The author has achieved a strict, compact and clear structure in this article, and has produced a coherent effect. Alexandre Dumas is also very good at writing dialogues between characters. Eight-tenths of the whole story is made up of dialogues, but it does not feel rigid, but more fluent and natural. From the dialogue of each character, the character of the character can be seen. And even the narration of the past events is composed of dialogues, like the reappearance of the past events, vivid and natural. This is also one of the great successes of Monte Cristo's Vengeance. The last feature is: clear image and outstanding personality. I think it goes without saying that those who have read it will not forget those distinctive characters! Whether it's the old priest Faria or the Count of Monte Cristo, those characters are already deeply imprinted in your heart, aren't they? In a word, The Count of Monte Cristo is a good example of popular fiction. I think it is necessary for us to have a good taste. It will be of great help to our future writing and reading.

title: Danger of web 3 security risks
body:
### New internet, new hardware devices, powerful security

The birth of the internet which is a new kind of technology in the 21st century has become a powerful tool ever created and brought into existence by man. It is a powerful tool because it has the ability to run from one planet to another planet with just a simple input by man.

Imagine the internet, that is web 3.0 as a black box or an emergency satchel like the one which the president of the United States is given to authorize a nuclear attack on another country farther away from its initial location. The internet functions that way but this time, oneâ€™s identity or codes can be secure for taking such actions.

The internet has become the mother and father of all technology because it has the ability and capacity to produce any type of value good or bad that can be consumed by the people who use the technology or internet. I consider the internet as a huge globe or universe but inside there are two small box-like planet both functioning identically though one is not secure and the other is secure for example web 2.0 and web 3.0.

When the world is evolving or re-creating itself into something new, society always develops and creates something new that will function in that world or anything that goes hand-in-hand with the new world. For instance, web 3.0 is a new technology, but decentralized and therefore new hardware devices are needed for a decentralized technology. And I mean hardware devices that has a 5th generation technology standard and high connectivity to work with web 3.0 technology because the old devices may have malicious software which we are unaware of and therefore corrupting any input data or information as well as application that we may want to download.

There is nothing in the world that does not need security, living and non-living things has some sort of security that protects them from anything malicious likewise machines. Security is paramount. powerful security is gold. It is the only thing that can keep everything in place and secure. Web 3.0 is not just about NFTs, trade in the blockchain, but it is really about security. That means people who utilize this new technology can do whatever they want in that space while their personal identifiable information and data is secure and protected in the blockchain for example, the dark web.

### Security and web 3.0 Vulnerabilities

It is impossible to build a world or a planet without putting strong foundational security in place otherwise everything that is built in the world or planet would crumble to the ground. Yes, technology is a powerful tool in the world but does not mean it has the best security in the world. Every new emerging technology that is built, and brought into existence always comes with all kinds of weakness or vulnerabilities.

The most powerful tool in the world that has the best security in place is the human mind. A strong mind has the ability to secure sensitive data and information within itself if it is properly guarded by whomever carries that mind, and builds a secure world from itâ€™s mind free from weakness or vulnerability. How is this part of the paragraph related to web 3.0?, well we all know web 3.0 means decentralization therefore data must be decentralized and encrypted that only the owner has access to it. But sometimes we cannot 100% trust the internet, hence web 3.0 even though it is decentralized due to malicious actors and software in that space.

There is a misconception about web 3.0 which is that, because it is a decentralize technology therefore no malicious actors or hackers, scammers cannot steal sensitive data and information from anyone who ventures into the space of web 3.0. Unfortunately, that is a very wrong understanding because malicious actors can definitely steal data. Now letâ€™s dive into the security risks of web 3.0 and provide some solutions how to better protect our data and information from bad actors.

* **Social engineering**:- Of course adapting to the new internet or technology always open the way for exploitation and threat of social engineering therefore web 3.0 is no exception. Individuals who intend to explore or venture in the web 3.0 space must be extremely careful not to get tricked into providing sensitive information such as their secret recovery phrase, passcode, or any PII that can access their wallet or data. An example of social engineering is phishing attack where an attacker masquerades him/herself as a reputable person or company through emails. The solution here is never to share PII or secret recovery phrase when asked by anyone even an autobot through emails or text messages.
* **Malware**:- Attackers can create their own malware such as a trojan horse which may distinguish as a legitimate software. And the attacker can implement the malware in any web 3.0 platform for anyone to mess around with it for example gaming, and music platforms. Another thing is attackers can deploy malicious smart contract onto the blockchain without anyone knowing he/she is signing onto a malicious smart contract because it does functions like a standard smart contract except that it is fake. It is important an individual verifies the source of the smart contract they would be signing by confirming the information written in the smart contract are legitimate.
* **ENS**:- ENS here stands for Ethereum name service domain. I honestly never thought that cybercriminals could use the ENS to track an individualâ€™s Ethereum address just by searching their simple names associated with their Ethereum address. Mr. Luis Monzon said it better when he wrote about the 5 most common security concerns for the web 3.0 world. He stated that, â€œ*the growing popularity of digital currency has resulted in greater use of Ethereum Name Service (ENS) domains. ENS domains are an easy to remember name used to find the associated cryptocurrency wallet address. This has led to popular domain names being trademarked and resold by third parties. As a result, nothing prevents the owner of an ENS domain from using that name to trick unsuspecting users into believing that they are dealing with a legitimate organization*â€ I believe the solution in this case is owning your ENS that is associated with the wallet address and locking it in the blockchain with a private key.

It is concluded and noted that web 3.0 technology is still in the early age, growing, and fresh out of the womb of web 2.0 technology though a very interesting and exciting blockchain technology. The best thing about web 3.0 technology is that it gives freedom to creators to do whatever they want with their creativity, art, and intellectual property in the blockchain while the technology offers security with the input of our private keys because it is a decentralize machine. I believe that as the technology is growing, we will be experiencing more security risks in the future. Therefore, let us be ready to do more work to secure our data and information just in case those upcoming security risks present itself.

### Reference

Monzon, Luis. (2022, April 16). The 5 most common security concerns for the web 3.0 world.

[https://www.itnewsafrica.com/2022/04/the-5-most-common-security-concerns-for-the-web-3-0-world/](https://www.itnewsafrica.com/2022/04/the-5-most-common-security-concerns-for-the-web-3-0-world/)

title: What is immutable metadata and why is it important?
body:
NFTs have a wide range of applications including:

* personal IDs
* collectibles
* â€¦

Right now, collectibles and art are the main applications of NFTs. From the chart below, we can see how NFTs are performing in different categories.

![Data Source: NFTGo.io](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/P3hfDsaOu_COjnwVW0HWx.png?height=646&width=1400)

In every category, NFTs represent ownership of an item. In the case of CryptoPunks, this item is a JPEG. For ENS, this is the .eth address and for Axie, this can be a game character.

**The recipe for an NFT**

All of these tokens follow the same blueprint, part of those is ERC721 standard. This standard helps us distinguish between a fungible and a non-fungible asset.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/CelNqtUraAfj9iU9G5sLr.png?height=700&width=1400)

You might have heard of the ERC1155 standard. It is an extension of an NFT. For our purposes, we can view both as tokenized digital goods.

Every NFT has a unique Id that points to its metadata, and itâ€™s like a fingerprint for a digital asset. This metadata can consist of an image and attributes etc.

**The anatomy of metadata**

Soâ€¦what do we see when first looking at an NFT?

![Data Source: NFTGo.io](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/s5WU9uIpwsBx1CPIlQLjz.png?height=761&width=1400)

The name of the NFT is in the title.

This is the name that the project chooses for an NFT, after that, Thereâ€™s the NFTâ€™s unique ID marked with a â€œ#â€. This ID is the NFTâ€™s fingerprint. Under the hood, in the [smart contract](https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/smart-contracts/) a link is generated from this ID that points to some metadata about the NFT. We collect the metadata of every NFT from the blockchain and present it to our users. Here, you can see that this NFT has an image and some properties, the NFTâ€™s metadata is like its ID card.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/d3IlSUSQf_k6aIlWgoIy5.png?height=700&width=1400)

If you want to see the program that websites like us read from to collect this metadata, you can see it here:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/u3JtGCJv9OX4t_IjgMknH.png?height=913&width=1400)

I will go over how you can find this raw data yourself. If youâ€™re interested in that, stay tuned!

**Where is the metadata stored?**

A common misconception that people might have is that their NFTâ€™s metadata is stored on the blockchain. This is true for some NFTs like CryptoPunks but itâ€™s not best practice. On-chain metadata is highly gas-intensive and can cause even hundreds of dollars. In this article, we will cover the difference between on-chain and off-chain metadata and compare them.

We now know that most NFT projects donâ€™t store data on the blockchain, so how do we make sure that our NFTâ€™s data is immutable?

**Immutability**

When we say something is immutable it means that it canâ€™t change. The $ETH you have in your wallet is stored on the Ethereum blockchain. Therefore, it is by nature immutable and no one can change it. This is a powerful phenomena that powers blockchain technology.

However, we are not at the point where we can store all the data for an NFT on-chain just like we store our transactions. Achieving immutability is a challenging topic in the NFT development ecosystem. At [NFTGo.io](https://nftgo.io/), we ask two questions to see if an NFTâ€™s metadata is immutable or not:

* Is the metadata stored on a decentralized file storage?
* Can the NFTâ€™s metadata change?

**The problem with mutability**

Some projects take the road of storing their NFTâ€™s metadata on a centralized database. This means that the owners of the database can change the metadata. There are other risks like:

* Hacks and cyber attacks
* Server problems causing the whole dataset to go down

Investors should be aware of these risks and realize that when an NFTâ€™s data is mutable, it questions whether they truly own the NFT. Some projects have no choice but to store the data in a centralized way, we will go more in-depth about that in a future article.

**NFTGo.io has made it easy**

Before, you should have done your due diligence to find out if your $100k NFT is really yours or not. [NFTGo.io](https://nftgo.io/)â€™s mission is to make the experience of buying an NFT as fluid and intuitive as possible. This is why we have the immutable tag on the NFTs that meet our criteria. This reduces the barrier to entry for new investors and makes old investorsâ€™ workflow smoother.

![Data Source: NFTGo.io](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/lA8ueK0iMUj3IibBzXWgh.png?height=700&width=1400)

**Getting nerdy!**

Our data is more than enough for most use-cases, but weâ€™ll gonna show you how to find the raw data yourself. All of this work is already done for you by NFTGo.io. This is just for you to see whatâ€™s going on under the hood. If youâ€™re curious, you can follow along!

There are four steps to this process:

1. Go on Etherscan (or the block explorer of your choice)
2. Find the NFTâ€™s contract
3. â€œReadâ€ from the contract (Iâ€™ll explain what that means)
4. Follow the URI you got back

Depending on how the contract is structured, there might be more steps that you have to take after step 3 but this is pretty much the pattern for most of NFT contracts out there.

First, we choose an NFT. On [NFTGo.io](https://nftgo.io/), we can see the ID of [this NFT](https://nftgo.io/asset/ETH/0xfc007068c862e69213dc7aa817063b1803d4e941/4744) is 4744.

![Data Source: NFTGo.io](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/35ldzO2VyP8rnjnIS63SO.png?height=764&width=1400)

If you scroll down, you will see the information about the project under the NFTâ€™s properties. Thereâ€™s an address that takes us to Etherscan, this is the projectâ€™s smart contract. You can think of an NFT smart contract as a vending machine. When you click on the mint button, this vending machine will give you your NFT. There are other things that are going on in an NFT smart contract, more on that in the future!

Now that weâ€™re on Etherscan, it is important that the projectâ€™s contract is â€œverifiedâ€. On the right top corner of the contract, thereâ€™s a little green tick button. This means that weâ€™re good to go. After you click on â€œcontractâ€, you will see 3 options: code, read contract, write contract. Click on â€œread contractâ€, there are a bunch of different functions there, but weâ€™re only interested in one of them. Find the â€œtokenURIâ€ function (which is usually at the end).

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/tVEiKl3eejUy_8elk7F0D.png?height=633&width=1400)

Remember I told you that an NFTâ€™s ID is like its fingerprint. Well, thatâ€™s exactly what weâ€™re going to use to get our NFTâ€™s metadata. After you click on the tokenURI function, you can write the NFTâ€™s ID in the input box. Click on the query button.

![Data Source: EtherScan](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/RVUPQk11ze_hdEYzsP725.png?height=292&width=1400)

And voila! You have â€œreadâ€™â€™ directly from the Ethereum blockchain. That was a lot of steps to get there, this is what our software does to get every NFTâ€™s metadata.

A big chunk of a blockchainâ€™s task is to store data. Block explorers like Etherscan enable us to Read from the blockchain and also Write to it. Keep in mind that reading from the blockchain doesnâ€™t cost any gas.

If youâ€™ve clicked on the query button, you will see a response from the blockchain. This is a link to where the NFTâ€™s metadata is stored, you can copy and paste this link on your browser. The page you see should be kind of familiar for you, we showed you earlier in this article the raw code for an NFTâ€™s metadata. This text file is stored somewhere (centralized or [decentralized](https://golden.com/query/decentralized-file-storage-projects-BYY)) and thatâ€™s how we determine our NFTâ€™s immutability.

If you see the link is pointing to a decentralized file storage, you can make sure that nobody has the power to change your NFT.

**Key takeaways**

In this article, you learned a ton about NFTs and hopefully, the concept of self-custody makes more sense to you. You also saw how [NFTGo.io](https://nftgo.io/) has made it so easy for you to see if the NFTâ€™s metadata is immutable or not. You also learned whatâ€™s going on behind the scenes. There are a few takeaways that I want to leave you with:

Blockchains are open and transparent platforms and by leveraging the data from the blockchain, you can ensure the safety of your assets. However, it is inconvenient to use the blockchain directly every time. [NFTGo.io](https://nftgo.io/) bridges the gap between daily users and the blockchain. This is all made for you to have a safe NFT purchase experience.

title: The rise of NFT DAOs
body:
The dynamics of governance, democracy, and community formation are all fascinating topics to discuss. These topics merge in the concept of DAOs. With the rise of DAOs such as the constitution DAO. the potential for these organizations is vast.

**The history of Crypto**

Blockchains started with cryptocurrencies and revolutionized money. After the token boom, now the light of NFTs is getting brighter. Everyone is paying attention to the hottest NFT projects. NFTs power art, metaverse and digital identity. The concept of JPEGs selling for millions of dollars on the web might have seemed outlandish even two years ago, just like how peer-to-peer cash would seem odd before Satoshi created Bitcoin.

What is the next wave in the blockchain ecosystem?

Will history repeat itself?

What is different this time?

We will explore these questions and more questions and concepts in this article.

**What is a DAO?**

DAOs are communities of people that collectively make decisions and vote for the future of the organization. By nature, these are autonomous and decentralized entities that are governed by the members. Many NFT projects can be thought of as a DAO, thereâ€™s a group of token holders together in a community that shares incentives. But the concept of a DAO can go way beyond just communities.

**Why DAOs?**

Out of all the ongoing efforts in the blockchain space, why do DAOs have the highest potential in pioneering the next revolution in blockchains?

DAOs solve problems that have existed long before Cryptocurrencies, these include:

* traditional organizations follow a hierarchical approach and decisions often are in favor of a small group
* Transparent voting systems
* Empowering the individual participants
* The need for trusting third parties to be ethical and fair

Rather than following a hierarchical approach, DAOs aim to empower every person. DAOs are not controlled by anyone, they are **trustless organizations**.

DAOs are the next revolution in blockchains because they are going after some of the hardest problems in human history: coordination and democracy

DAOs have the flexibility and power to enter any industry. From shifting companies and communities to even governments, the potential for DAOs is vast.

**The revolution sequence**

Revolutionary technologies leverage the older tools and innovate to build a new tool. Isaac Newton famously said:

â€œ If I have seen further it is by standing on the shoulders of Giantsâ€

We can look at innovative technologies as sequential events that build up from the existing ones. Bitcoin and Ethereum built up from the internet and cryptography. NFTs built on top of Ethereum,

What if the next generation of DAOs are powered by NFTs?

**New paradigm**

In the past, DAOs have collectively come together to fund something or make decisions on the future of a protocol.

[PleasrDAO](https://pleasr.org/#) famously took off when a group of NFT enthusiasts pooled together to make a million-dollar investment in an animation made by artist [pplpleasr](https://twitter.com/pplpleasr1).

*â€œWe live in a world where an ape just got elected to the board of a 9-figure DAO based on nothing more than his high school student council credentials and his love of NFTâ€™s.*

*What a time to be alive.[@PleasrDAO](https://twitter.com/PleasrDAO?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw) âœ¨â€*

â€” gmoney.eth (@gmoneyNFT) [June 23, 2021](https://twitter.com/gmoneyNFT/status/1407508585458831360?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

Since then, this DAO has collected and funded art pieces; they own the original Doge NFT. The initial investment was at around $2M.This NFT was then fractionalized and turned into DogeCoin. The DAO decided to make an ERC20 token backed by this NFT. The token is #12th in [coinmarketcapâ€™s rankings](https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/dogecoin/) across other cryptocurrencies.

[PleasrDAO](https://pleasr.org/#) has just scratched the surface of what is possible when NFTs merge with DAOs.

As DAOs start to enter new domains, thereâ€™s a need for infrastructure and tools for managing the organization.

NFTs have been used as a form of identity and have proven to be successful in that domain. By leveraging NFTs, all DAOs can manage users. This idea can be extended further if we start to think about the NFTs having attributes such as voting power etc.

Other than the general application of non-fungible tokens in the DAO space, there are use-cases specific to NFTs and collectors that we can explore.

**NFTs + DAOs = ?**

DAOs are shaped by mutual ideas. Pleasr DAO showed us the power and value that can be created by a community of like-minded NFT enthusiasts. But this idea can go beyond collectively collecting NFTs.

DAOs can fundamentally change the way NFT projects and artists start. Today, most NFT projects (with exceptions) start from an already existing media company or self-funded artists. This limits the spread of NFTs and soon, NFTs can suffer from centralization risk.

Governing the future of NFTs should be in the hands of the creators and contributors. DAOs empower the investors and creators by giving them a voice in the community and control over the direction of NFTs.

This is a stark contrast to how NFTs are currently created and sold. Communities donâ€™t go beyond an exclusive Discord chat. The decision-makers are in a centralized company or a small team and supporters are not getting the maximum reward possible for being early adopters.

When the power of deciding for the future of NFTs is in the hands of people, the possibilities are unlimited. This was proven by us when months ago [The Loot Project](https://nftgo.io/collection/loot-for-adventurers/overview) started. The project gave control to the community and is powered by the collective creativity of the community. Loot is now clocking at 7th place in NFTGOâ€™s rankings with over a $160M market cap.

Although there have been efforts to create â€œpseudoDAOsâ€ in the NFT space, the possible implications of an NFT focused DAO is still open to discussion.

**Social experiments**

After disrupting centralized governance strategies, DAOs are moving to social networks. The promise of Web2.0 was an interactive and distributed application. Early on, this was an exciting moment for everyone. Weâ€™re way beyond those times and centralized social network providers are starting to show their flaws. From Facebook changing the result for the US election to Twitter suspending out-spoken people, more than ever, thereâ€™s the need for decentralized protocols to step in and make the unbounded social networking experience possible.

In theory, blockchains are capable of transforming social networks for the better. Though in practice, many of the solutions are still experimental.

[Monaco](https://monaconft.io/) is one of the emerging decentralized apps that is experimenting with decentralized social networks. They bring the same feelings of Twitter but in an NFT native social platform. For using the app, users have to own the projectâ€™s NFTs.

![Image Source: Monaco](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/zighx9_kSUEfVO1m9BMy5.png?height=743&width=1400)

A more DAO-focused social app is [FWB](https://www.fwb.help/). Entering the DAO requires a written application which will be reviewed by the members of the community and a certain amount of their ERC-20 token. This comes with the promise of a community of engaged people that will work towards funding artists and talented people.

**[NFTGO](https://nftgo.io/) Pioneer** is driven by the values of the thriving NFT community. The decentralized protocol aims to revolutionize the community by replacing the old and slow model of centralized innovation and decision-making in NFT projects with a radically efficient and decentralized ecosystem. We aim to reduce the obstacles for new artists and talent to enter the NFT space.

title: How I keep getting rekt
body:
I got into crypto in December 2017 due to the peak crypto mania everywhere by buying $LTC around $300 and kept averaging it down till $250. 
 And then bought $XRP at $3 and $ETH at $1400 and BTC at $19k.

In addition to buying at the top I kept selling whenever it dips and rebuying higher eventually selling everything when BTC dumped to around $6k thinking that this could dump even further and slept for the night. 
 Seems like that was the only night I had good sleep for that week, guess why?

Because next day when I woke up all coins I sold pumped around 10% but I thought they will dump soon instead they kept pumping hard for the next 4days straight after which I eventually bought the stack I sold after a 50-60% rally.

I was lucky enough that even after I bought they rallied another 30-40% up but I didnâ€™t sell thinking it goes higher after which everything dumped hard. 
 I kept selling low and buying high which made me lost most of my money. 
  
 You all know what happened after May 2018 rally. 
 I stopped looking at my portfolio for a while but later got introduced to Masternodes and then mining then leverage trading. So, tried those with additional money to eventually lose it all. 
  
 I started buying BTC around $10k area and ETH around $200 in end of 2019/early 2020 but dumped it all at more than 50% loss in the March 2020 covid dump. 
 Apart from that started shorting bitcoin with some BTC thats left with me from $6K which got liquidated around $10k. 
  
 After that deposited more USD and started shorting btc with USDC which got liquidated at $20K and finally thats where I stopped leverage trading. 
  
 And I didnâ€™t stop there as usual bought bunch of alts around May 2021 top which got dumped more than 80% and the cycle continues. 
  
 Now I no longer sell any assets that were down 90-99% instead just hoping for a mega alt season like 2017 whenever it happens hopefully before early 2022 so I can atleast make it all back what I lost with some more profits so I can keep continuing in crypto space. 
  
 My sincere advice to new people in crypto to not over invest and try to learn some basic technical analysis where you can use High Time Frame levels to enter/exit trades and donâ€™t keep fomoing for every small move in Low Time Frame. Also, better start buying in bear markets when volatility is low and keep an eye on new trends. Also, try to interact with new protocols which could earn some airdrops in bull market.

title: How To Make An NFT: A Beginnerâ€™s Guide
body:
Non-fungible tokens (NFTs) have exploded in popularity over the past few years, with prices for these tokens skyrocketing as collectors scramble to obtain rare and unique collectibles for their digital wallets.

NFTs differ from traditional cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin because NFTs are tied directly to unique digital assets. While anyone can use cryptocurrencies to transfer - or trade - any fungible asset (one that has no differentiation), NFTs can only be used for trading one-of-a-kind assets.

This means that nearly anyone can create their own NFTs to represent unique digital assets, whether they are games, collectibles, or something else entirely.

If you are lucky, it can also mean that your NFTs will be worth a significant amount of money if the asset they represent becomes popular.

Are you ready to start trading? Here's how to get started:

## Step 1: Choose Your Asset

The first step to making your own NFT is to pick an asset. The asset that you turn into an NFT can be nearly anything: a digital music album, a 3D model of a character, an access pass to an event, or even real-world items like stocks or gold bars. Below is the value share of each category, you could also have a basic overview of different categories.

![Data Source: NFTGo.io](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/EekOR41mBOFcMlVvu0fnX.png?height=946&width=1656)

As you brainstorm possible NFTs that your project could represent, remember that the best collectibles are unique and rare.

If your asset is too common, it won't be valuable because anyone can easily create an NFT to represent it, and no one will want to buy yours.

## Step 2: Determine Your Token's Function

The next step is to decide how you want your NFTÂ  to function within its network. To do this, you'll need to think about:

* How people will interact with the NFT (what functions it will be able to perform).
* How other projects can interact with it (how your NFTÂ  can interact with others).

Much of this will depend on the blockchain network you want to host your NFT on.

For example, if you'd like your token to be used within a decentralized game, it's important that users can use the NFT to generate and store in-game currency. Otherwise, players won't have a way to purchase or collect resources.

## Step 3: Set Up Your Wallet

You will need to have a digital wallet to store your NFTs once you start trading. You can quickly set up a wallet and load it with cryptocurrency on a number of different platforms, including:

* [Metamask](https://metamask.io/)
* [AlphaWallet](https://alphawallet.com/)
* [Trust Wallet](https://trustwallet.com/)
* [Coinbase Wallet](https://www.coinbase.com/wallet)

Once you set up your wallet, make a note of your wallet address. You'll need this later to create your NFTs.

## Step 4: Register As An Owner Of The Asset

To create an NFT, you will need the private key for the wallet that represents the asset you want to tokenize.

You can then head to an NFT marketplace to â€œmintâ€ your NFT on the blockchain. You will need to register your wallet and then follow the steps to register your NFT properly.

Ethereum and Ethereum-based NFTs are widely available, but if you're working with a different blockchain platform, you may need to do some research on the best marketplace for your asset.

Some of today's top NFT marketplaces include:

* [OpenSea](https://opensea.io/)
* [Axie Marketplace](https://marketplace.axieinfinity.com/)
* [Nifty Gateway](https://niftygateway.com/)
* [Rarible](https://rarible.com/)
* [Binance NFT](https://www.binance.com/en/nft/home)

Each marketplace appeals to different buyers and sellers, and as such, you will want to choose one that has a strong track record and meets your requirements.

## Step 5: Set Up Your NFT

When you register with an NFT marketplace, you will be asked to enter some information about your NFTÂ  function, the numbers, and the dates.

You'll also need the address of your wallet (which you made in Step 3) and the private key for that wallet (which you made in Step 4).

Updating your NFT is as simple as visiting the marketplace, uploading your NFTâ€™s information, and updating its metadata. You can then list it on your marketplace of choice to start trading immediately!

## Step 6: Put Your NFT Up For Bid

Some makers simply want to create and display their NFTs without trading, but if you want to start buying and selling your NFTs as quickly as possible, you can list them on an auction.

These blockchain auctions work in a similar way to real-world auctions. When you put your NFT up for bid, it will be sold to the highest bidder when the auction ends. You will then receive the winning purchase price in cryptocurrency minus the marketplace's transaction fees.

## Step 7: Celebrate Your New NFT Success!

Congrats, you are now a creator of NFTs!

Once you set up the process the first time, creating and minting new NFTs is simple. You can create as many as you want, and you can use your project to explore new business models, test out existing ones, or even create games with blockchain-powered currencies.

Now that you know how to create NFTs, you can add them to your digital wallet. Get started today, and learn how to create NFTs that can benefit you and your business in the new digital marketplace.

title: I am decided now... right?
body:
As I was wandering in my mind during this trying times, I could recall that all I thought I didn't knew, indeed I used to knew it. So you may think, why didn't you realized it early? That one is an easy one: for so many, the obvious is not that much obvious sometimes. Let me explain it to you a little bit.

## The beggining of the knowing

I am now in my 30s, but everything started in my early 20s, when I started to structure myself as a TradFi guy (even though, I am still kinda one of those). The stock market, the financial risks, the banking and above all, the money, was the most important concepts I wanted to know for sure.

So, the internship in a brokerage I got by winning a kind-of-a-nerd-writing-contest for a well known regulator institution in my country, just gave the perfect opportunity to start with the knowing of those delicious financial concepts.

Bonds, stocks, investments, pricing, interest rates, were the first glares of knowledge I started to absorb. And of course, those concepts were addicting. The job enviroment was not the best, but of course I was young and that didnâ€™t matter at all (now I know that indeed does).

As little I knew back then was the most important things that could ever happened to me. Why? Because the unknowns knowns of that time were the source of the curiosity I used to absorb everything.

Then, 2 years later, the thirsty curiosity for new unknowns knowns was the main reason I dare to quit. But, of course, I didnâ€™t quit at random. There was another kind-of-a-nerd-writing-contest from where, once again, I won an intership. This time in a risk assessment firm. TouchÃ©.

Those new juicy financial risk concepts were the new mainstream in my life. The way that those unknowns knowns were filling my not-so-much-shy knwoledge, let me introduce to myself to a new understanding of the human behavior: we are not that much good at finance and overall, at using money.

## The knowing

By that time, the now well-known book ***The Psychology of Money: Timeless lessons on wealth, greed, and happiness*** was not even thought to be published (as far as I know). So, I didnâ€™t have a broad understanding of why we do the things we do with our money. What a shame.

Wrapping up my thoughts and meaningful chatter inside my head, I was able to notice that I might know something that could be useful for my sorrounding people. So, I started to ask questions. Some questions not well received, some others very smile answered.

Then, I knew it. I was meant to be the â€œlearnerâ€ but in a different way. The good old way: learning-by-teaching way. So I decided to begin to teach some of the core concepts of what I was ripping my head off these last couple of years.

But as you might already realized by yourselves in your own life, the also ***well-well-know*** Impostor Syndrome came to action. And yes, it was so much devasteting as yours maybe. So, I did quit. But this time it was a resounding quit.

I didnâ€™t want to know about sharing anything to anybody. Why? Simple because I was ashamed of myself and my lack of encourage. So, a couple of years must have to passed to enlight to myself the last piece I needed to know.

## The last knowing

After all the effort, all the thirst for knowledge for financial concepts and all the experience gathered during my starting days, the concept finale was missing.

And it was so easy to realize about it.

A self, non centralized, type of money was the answer for it: bitcoin. And as simple as that all the crypto-bro world came to me. Bitcoin at first, Etherium second and all the crypto ecosystem was the last knowing I did want to know. I was hopping down the rabbit hole.

It was scaring to start learning about what was missing in my knowing path. Because, of course you are scared of stuff. Even more if that matter is what you like the most. You want to nail it. But, how? (I think I already answered that, but here it comes).

So, yes, I am learning. I will keep doing it. I already know so much enough than the common individual using *fiat*. And I am grateful for that. I will come back to teach to my people once again.

## The deciding

As I write these words, I am scared, but decided. I will come back like never before, knowing I know my unknowns, thirsty for new knowledge, but now focused on DeFi concepts and all the crypto ecosystem.

With crypto, all my desires for knowledge are being fulfilled. And becoming a clichÃ© learner-by-teaching individual is the way.

I am decided now to teach about crypto and DeFi. And I think I made that clearâ€¦ right?

title: Anyone who bought a home
body:
Anyone who bought a home -- or tried to -- over the past couple of years knows that it was rip-roaringly competitive, with buyers offering well above asking price and all-cash deals. But it actually could have been worse. One group all but disappeared from the market during the pandemic: Foreign buyers.

But now foreign real estate investments are slowly coming back, according to a survey from the National Association of Realtors.

[Travel restrictions](https://www.cnn.com/travel/article/us-state-travel-restrictions-covid-19/index.html#:\~:text=(CNN)%20%E2%80%94%20US%20travel%20restrictions,date%20with%20your%20Covid%20vaccines.) during the pandemic barred prospective buyers from abroad from traveling to the US and shopping for homes. But with those restrictions falling away -- along with many [Covid testing requirements](https://www.cnn.com/2022/06/10/politics/us-to-end-pre-departure-testing-requirement/index.html) -- foreign buyers have returned. Between April 2021 and March of this year, international buyers snatched up $59 billion worth of US residential properties. That was up 8.5% from the previous year, breaking a three-year streak of declines.

* 

The increase in dollar volume was largely due to rising purchase prices, according to the report. The median price of homes purchased by foreign buyers between April 2021 and March of this year was a record $366,100, even higher than the median $355,700 home price for the US market.
