title: Some women
body:
Some women view such cases as cautionary tales for how men may seek to quash women's speech about the nature of intimate encounters that they believe is untrue and damaging. Women who spoke to CNN Business about sharing about bad dates online, whose last names are being withheld to protect the privacy of parties involved, recalled anonymous comments in response to their posts threatening legal action. There has also been at least one lawsuit, in the case of a journalist who started a now-infamous list of allegedly bad men in the media industry.

While Crystal hasn't used her ex's full name, legal experts say there could still be risks to this kind of posting, as underscored by the Depp-Heard defamation trial.

"Even when you speak literally true statements, the fact that a man can say, 'People are going to draw inferences about this ...,' it's incredibly chilling," said Mary Anne Franks, a professor at the University of Miami's School of Law.

The Depp-Heard verdict, Franks said, "really seems to be sending a message to women that they're just not allowed to speak about abuse anywhere, in any form â€” whether they name them or don't name them, whether they're specific or not specific, it doesn't matter."

Crystal, however, told CNN Business that she doesn't believe she has overstepped: "This is the beginning of the movement and I'm so happy I'm on the forefront."

title: The stories
body:
The stories from women in online groups run the gamut from ghosting and cheating, to so-called ["stealthing" ](https://www.cnn.com/2021/10/15/opinions/stealthing-california-law-michaela-coel-stewart/index.html)(the act of non-consensually removing a condom during sex), and misogynistic comments that one might expect on certain corners of the internet but not necessarily from a new connection made via a dating app. In their accounts, they provide varying levels of personal details about the people involved, such as first names, ages, screenshots from dating app profiles and other information.

* 

But women who attempt to protect other women in this manner also open themselves up to backlash, including legal risks, even if they don't fully identify the man. In one of Crystal's most recent TikToks on the topic, she begins: "Today, I received a cease-and-desist in my inbox about my TikToks." A copy of the document viewed by CNN Business calls on Crystal to refrain from "further defamatory conduct on social media" of her ex, including posts about direct messages "intended to cause reputational injury" or videos of him.

The apparent legal threat Crystal received â€” which is from an attorney in the San Diego area who said she was representing her ex â€” came against the backdrop of the defamation [trial between Johnny Depp and Amber Heard](https://www.cnn.com/2022/06/01/entertainment/johnny-depp-amber-heard-verdict/index.html). The case drew [significant attention](https://www.cnn.com/videos/us/2022/06/01/johnny-depp-amber-heard-defamation-trial-verdict-lead-casarez-pkg-vpx.cnn) in part because a woman was being held legally accountable for a public allegation about an intimate relationship. It centered on a 2018 Washington Post op-ed in which Heard described being a victim of domestic abuse, but did not name Depp in the piece. (A jury found both Depp and Heard liable for defamation but awarded more money in damages to Depp in a win for the actor.) Following Depp's lead, Marilyn Manson, the musician who is also the actor's friend, filed in March a defamation case against his ex, the actress Evan Rachel Wood, whose [sexual abuse and intimate partner violence claims](https://www.cnn.com/2022/01/24/entertainment/evan-rachel-wood-marilyn-manson-documentary-phoenix-rising/index.html) were the subject of the recent [HBO documentary "Phoenix Rising."](https://www.cnn.com/2022/03/15/entertainment/phoenix-rising-review/index.html) The suit is ongoing.

title: Such groups may
body:
Such groups may have unintended consequences, such as other group members taking matters into their own hands to track down a person to send critical messages or men losing privacy when they are proactively posted about as women seek to ensure they will be safe should they go on a date with them. Still, some online safety experts say the groups can act as a stop-gap measure for when dating apps â€” which still struggle to address harassment and other problematic behavior, such as the creation of multiple profiles under different names â€” fail to keep women and other marginalized groups safe.

"You see a lot of mischief online in ways that torment and exploit the privacy of women, girls and minorities ... \[and yet\] we're gnashing our teeth when people are using online tools to protect themselves," said Danielle Citron, a professor at the University of Virginia School of Law and director of the LawTech Center. "I'm not saying that this is the way to do it ... but when you have no other alternative, when you don't have accountability, people take self-protective measures into their own hands."

In general, dating apps have [long failed](https://www.propublica.org/article/dating-apps-can-be-dangerous-congress-is-investigating) to adequately screen or vet who signs up to use their services. They require little information to create a profile, making it difficult to pre-screen accounts before they're able to begin connecting with others. While some have introduced varying measures intended to crack down on bad actors, much of the content moderation happens after accounts are created, and it is based, at least in part, on user reports. (Garbo, a newly-launched nonprofit background check provider, which has received funding from Match Group ([MTCH](https://money.cnn.com/quote/quote.html?symb=MTCH&source=story_quote_link)), is trying to change that. Recognizing the trend of TikTokers sharing details of their bad dates, Garbo's corporate TikTok account re-shared one post and commented: "This is exactly why we exist.")

title: In search of a safe space for women online
body:
### In search of a safe space for women online

For years, women have tried to find ways to create tech-enabled whisper networks that could serve to protect other women from bad experiences with men they'd encountered â€” with mixed success.

In the fall of 2017, with disgraced Hollywood mogul Harvey Weinstein in the spotlight, writer Moira Donegan started a Google spreadsheet devoted to doing just that among some men in media. It was called the ["Shitty Media Men List,"](https://www.vox.com/culture/2018/1/11/16877966/shitty-media-men-list-explained) and allowed women to anonymously post the names of men and their alleged negative experiences with them. It included misconduct allegations ranging from the more specific such as "rape accusations," and "hitting women, secretively removing condom during sex" to more vague descriptors like "workplace harassment."

title: While intended to stay u
body:
While intended to stay under-the-radar, it quickly spiraled beyond its original purpose and Donegan took down the document after 12 hours. "In the beginning, I only wanted to create a place for women to share their stories of harassment and assault without being needlessly discredited or judged," Donegan [wrote](https://www.thecut.com/2018/01/moira-donegan-i-started-the-media-men-list.html) in 2018. One of the men listed on the sheet, author Stephen Elliott, is [suing](https://www.theguardian.com/media/2018/oct/11/shitty-media-men-lawsuit-stephen-elliott-moira-donegan) Donegan â€” now a writer at The Guardian who covers gender and politics â€” for libel. In a July 1 court filing, the parties indicated their intent to settle; a hearing on the matter has been scheduled for this fall. Counsel for Elliott did not immediately return a request for comment.

Attorney Roberta Kaplan is representing Donegan in her case. Kaplan is the co-founder of Time's Up, the organization which grew out of the "Me Too" movement , but resigned from the group in August 2021 over her ties to former New York Governor Andrew Cuomo.

Kaplan did not respond to a request for comment. According to court documents, Donegan sought protection under [Section 230](https://www.cnn.com/2020/02/25/tech/section-230-doj/index.html) of the Communications Decency Act (often referred to as a liability shield for tech platforms), claiming that she cannot be held liable for the allegedly defamatory content as she did not solicit allegedly false statements or create the content in question.

title: night like water
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/nWJi_WJqOFiyNvsS1GBEx.png?height=266&width=430)

It was night, silent, and everything was silent.
The wind blows lightly, with a hint of coolness. The heat of summer disappears without a trace at night. Looking up at the sky, there are a few stars on the horizon, dotted with the night. Under my feet, the small road I walk every day is still lonely today, and the silence is beautiful.
I like nights like this, when the moonlight flows like water. When the hustle and bustle hides into silence, the agile breeze draws the tired heart to linger on the bank of the willows, flying like the wind.


Walking slowly, walking in the calm night. There is water-like clarity everywhere, not gorgeous, not gorgeous, but it makes people feel aloof, blurred and charming. There is still a faint floral fragrance in the wind, which is the trace left by the season. In the moonlight, the shadows of the trees whirling, the warm wind shakes the flowers and trees, and the tacit fragrance is swaying. It is elegant and hazy, and the style is infinite in the moonlit night.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Fj8Tv3Phe4XBNirxp7VBE.png?height=283&width=429)


The night is clear, the wind is clear and the moon is bright, and the beauty is like ink. "The cloud breaks the moon and the flowers play in the shadows, the wind is uncertain, the people are quiet at the beginning, and the bright moon should be full of red." I whispered the verse that I didn't know from there, and quietly felt the elegance that bloomed quietly under the moon.
Staring, watching the stars all over the sky shattered into mottles, falling into the small lotus pond in the distance, reflecting the little water light, pure and leisurely. The fine moonlight, sprinkled with silver and white, reflected in the flowers, turned into crystal dew, mottled and beautiful. I am intoxicated, indulged in the ethereal elegance, light, light, like the quietness of misty rain, ethereal and distant.
The night is deep, and the serenity of the road is more intense. I looked towards the bright moon with nostalgia, where a cloud drifted past like a veil, quietly concealing the shyness of the moon. A touch of sweetness, a gentle stretch, the wind is soft and the moon is full, and the night is fading. Let the moonlight fall on the ground. In the moonlight, the memory seems to become transparent as well, stretching the freedom in the breeze, filled with warmth.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-LVwci2zxlMb2u3yPzX-G.png?height=270&width=426)


The gentle moonlight, covering the coldness of the night, the cool wind, blowing recklessly through the window of memory, the beauty in dreams, and the sadness of waiting are all immersed in the silence of the night. A sigh came from far away in the wind, it was the bright moon, and the story hidden in the heart fluttered into a fragrance in the wind, finely broken and faint.
Borrow a wisp of the wind's feelings, drink a clear and ethereal cup, and enjoy a calm mood with a song of people leaning on the solitary building. That moon, as if coming from the ancient fragrance of ink, was as tranquil as water, accompanied by a wisp of wind, and quietly closed the corners of the flying clothes. With the rhythm of the moon, you can integrate your heart into the tranquility, and feel the kind of pleasant, gentle, exile of the mind of dyeing incense.
Quietly, let your mind get lost in the cool and dreamy moonlit night. The flower language of the season seems to be heard in the distance, and the heart also begins to listen...

title: Her friend, who also
body:
Her friend, who also spoke to CNN Business about the TikToks, said having Eden post about her experience provided a "protective barrier" to backlash but she felt it was important to make the incident public. "I hated the idea of knowing that \[the woman in the video\] had no idea what was going on behind the scenes or how he was treating other people," she said.

"Men can do really sh\*\*\*y things and we have to question ourselves like, 'Is it worth speaking up about?'" Eden told CNN Business. She said it is an example of how women often must weigh the risk of legal, reputational and other potential consequences against the various reasons they might want to share their personal experiences, including to help other women.

"Obviously, there's going to be a backlash â€” almost guaranteed," said Eden.

title: Paola, who asked
body:
Paola, who asked that her last name be withheld for privacy and safety reasons, said she was motivated to create private online forums to help facilitate this type of information-sharing about dating experiences among women. Some of these groups count thousands or tens of thousands of women as members. Due to the nature of dating apps, she said, people "can easily get away with ... hurting girls, cheating, lying and all that stuff."

"It's very needed, something to prevent that," she said. But as more and more women join her groups, some men have learned they've been the subjects of some of their posts. . Then come takedown requests and legal threats, directed at both members and the groups themselves.

It wasn't some questioning or angry message, it was another photo.

It looked like a family portrait, with Catherine sitting saintly on a sofa in a white dress, flanked by people who looked like her parents.

Yin Caiyu was leng leng, what does this mean?

title: autumn
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/6cmKfpNkXaccc0DBwtKFp.png?height=266&width=435)

The most poetic season is autumn. Many literati and writers have written hymns for autumn. They try their best to render the beauty of autumn and spare no effort in writing. It can be seen how charming autumn is. Qiu is the best at distributing his feelings, no matter where he goes, people will feel its caress. Autumn is the best at picking gifts. The gifts it gives to everyone are unique and decorated with the most beautiful love. Qiu is so cute that people can't help but be moved by it, I can't help but call Qiu to collect the ubiquitous love.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/B5iDInhmCzFJ3NT4NyGd6.png?height=270&width=381)


Autumn love is in the fields, look!
Pieces of golden color, trees full of heavy fruits are gifts of autumn. Autumn is generous and selfless, yet it is only generous and selfless to the hard-working people, and its gifts are in return for them. The golden yellow everywhere reminds me of the spring jasmine flowers. The golden yellow that people love is full of mature charm.
The bright color reflected in people's eyes, and turned into a thick smile, covering the brows and the bottom of the eyes. I religiously picked up a piece of gold and put it in my heart.
Autumn love is in the far-reaching sky. Looking up, his eyes are full of fresh azure blue. Occasionally, a few soft clouds floated leisurely in front of my eyes, like a boat gently rowing past. I suddenly felt that it was not that I was looking up at the sky, but that the sky embraced me and embraced me with its broad mind. At this point, I seemed to be separated from myself and completely indulged in its gentle embrace. Autumn love on blooming flowers. That standout flower is the chrysanthemum. Chrysanthemum, it is neither delicate nor luxurious. But its extraordinary temperament and arrogant attitude attract everyone. In front of it, you will think of the word "arrogant". Yes, they are arrogant, and they do not hide their arrogance, nor do they pretend, but stand upright with their strong and iron bones, and bear people's eyes proudly and calmly. We should be grateful for the love given to us in autumn. When the flowers fall and before the cold comes, it brings us such a strong vitality of life. This should be the best gift for us.
Autumn love is in the autumn leaves. Autumn leaves are the most indispensable ornaments in autumn; only with them can a complete autumn be called.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vpawV6vJcBzojGoDGG6FI.png?height=266&width=471)


It is no wonder that the deepest love in autumn is always sprinkled on the moment when the leaves are fluttering with the wind and the wind is dancing with the leaves. It belongs to each of us. We can enjoy the dancing of the fallen leaves on a charming evening and listen quietly. The low singing of the autumn wind, let them affect the tenderness in my heart.
Some people say that the autumn wind is ruthless, perhaps because it shakes off the dead leaves and scatters the warmth. However, is the autumn wind really ruthless? I think of it as "Tao is ruthless yet affectionate". When a trace of autumn wind blew, it brought the news of autumn. It spreads a smile and gently brushes away the irritability of summer. It dances gracefully, holding the fallen leaves and rushing to the ground...

title: Crystal, the hairdresser,
body:
Crystal, the hairdresser, similarly told CNN Business that the intent wasn't to blow up her ex's life but rather to prevent other women from experiencing what she had with the same person.

* 

She said she was careful not to share too many details about her ex, such as his full name or where he works, but enough information that she feels she's doing her part to warn others, which she sees as the only real solution.

"I have only told the truth. I will not stop telling the truth," Crystal said in her TikTok about the cease-and-desist letter. But she has not posted any videos about her ex since she revealed she'd received the apparent legal threat more than a month ago. She told CNN Business she isn't scared or backing down, though. "Accountability isn't linear," she said. "As information comes to me, I will still be posting."

title: France is in the mid
body:
France is in the midst of an energy crisis: Russia continues to cut off supply to Europe while [historic heatwaves](https://edition.cnn.com/2022/07/18/energy/europe-gas-crisis-heatwave/index.html) are causing a spike in demand for gas to cool homes.

A cold winter lies ahead if prices continue to rise. But some help, temporary at least, may have just touched down in Paris.

The president of the United Arab Emirates, Sheikh Mohammed bin Zayed al-Nahyan, landed in the French capital Monday to discuss the "future of energy" between the two nations with President [Emmanuel Macron](https://edition.cnn.com/2022/06/22/europe/macron-deep-divisions-france-intl/index.html). It's the first visit by a UAE leader to France since 1991, according to the Elysee, and is Sheikh Mohammed's first trip to a western nation since taking office as President, underlying the strength of relations between the two countries.

title: Prospects are
body:
Prospects are bleak for the entire UK economy, according to a report on financial stability published earlier this month from the Bank of England, which said the outlook for the country's economy had "deteriorated materially." The Paris-based Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development forecast in June that the UK economy was heading to stagnation, with zero GDP growth forecast for 2023.

That's a downbeat environment for businesses, especially those still recovering from the difficult pandemic years.

* 

For Starbucks ([SBUX](https://money.cnn.com/quote/quote.html?symb=SBUX&source=story_quote_link)), [coffee sales were hit](https://www.cnn.com/2020/07/28/business/starbucks-earnings-coronavirus/index.html) when customers began working from home. As employees start making their way back to offices, the trend has turned around. Starbucks' UK sales improved significantly in the quarter ended April 3, Michael Conway, group president of international and channel development, said during a May analyst call.

"Traffic continues to come into Central London metro areas, and we are increasing drive-throughs in that market at a significant rate," he said.

* 

Starbucks had about 300 company-operated stores and roughly another 800 licensed locations in the United Kingdom as of October 2021. The coffee chain launched operations in the UK in 1998.

title: 'A message to the US'
body:
### 'A message to the US'

Sheikh Mohammed's visit comes after [US President Joe Biden's trip to Saudi Arabia](https://edition.cnn.com/2022/07/15/politics/oil-politics-joe-biden-saudi-arabia/index.html), as Western powers hope Riyadh and the UAE will increase oil output to bring down soaring energy prices stemming from Russian invasion of Ukraine. Concerns over Europe's energy supply have heightened further this week amid fears Russia will keep the taps turned off on the Nord Stream 1 pipeline â€” a crucial artery linking Russia's gas to the bloc.

"This visit could also be a message sent to the US, which is the traditional ally to the UAE in the region in a context where the US is withdrawing from the region; it's not perceived as a reliable ally anymore. Elysee has a lot to take advantage of on this visit," said Gadel.

UAE and France's foreign policies have aligned on precarious security matters, mainly Libya and Lebanon. And just last year France granted its largest-ever overseas sale of the Rafale warplane to the UAE â€” right before the Gulf Arab nation put an agreement with the US for F35 jet fighters on hold.

Those ties were most recently on display after France's largest-ever overseas sale of the Rafale warplane to the UAE in a deal worth $19 billion at the time â€” right before the Gulf Arab nation put an agreement with the US for F35 jet fighters on hold.

"The UAE and France will explore further areas of cooperation such as sustainability and the future of energy, which is central to the President's vision for the country," UAE Presidential Adviser Anwar Gargash said during a briefing on the weekend.

Gargash also said the UAE is directing its oil supplies away from the far east and toward Europe, adding that the Gulf state is investing in "greater energy capacity" to meet global demand in the wake of Russia's invasion of Ukraine. He added the caveat that any decisions on energy are "part of a big group" â€” referring to OPEC and its allies â€” and that the UAE will abide by that groups decisions.

* 

The UAE Ambassador to France Hend Al Otaiba said in a statement that the UAE's friendship with France, which is built on decades of deep political and economic partnerships, continues to provide "a lasting sense of optimism for the future."

"The choice of France as the President's first official visit is "a conscious one" Gargash said, marking the "strong" and "historic" relations between the two nations.

title: reportedly looking for an exit.
body:
As [prices surge](https://www.cnn.com/2022/06/22/economy/uk-inflation-may/index.html) and the [UK economy struggles more than most of its peers](https://edition.cnn.com/2022/07/07/economy/boris-johnson-resignation-economy/index.html), Starbucks is reportedly looking for an exit.

The company is engaged with advisers to determine whether it could â€” or should â€” sell its business in the United Kingdom, [according to UK newspaper The Times](https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/starbucks-explores-sale-of-uk-division-gmldppm6f).

Asked for comment, Starbucks shared with CNN Business an email it sent its UK staff over the weekend denying the company is engaged in a "formal sale process" and asserting its desire to remain in the region.

* 

The report comes at a time that the UK economy is in tough shape, making it difficult for businesses to operate and for residents to make ends meet. UK inflation hit 9.1% in May â€” a 40-year high and the highest rate among the leading G7 economies. And there's no relief in sight: Inflation is forecast to climb above 11% later this year.

* 

Food prices in [particular have been soaring](https://www.cnn.com/2022/05/16/business-food/fish-and-chips-britain-inflation/index.html), creating a cost of living crisis for many in the UK. Disposable incomes are on track for the second biggest fall since record keeping began in 1964, according to the Bank of England.

title: The story on the clock
body:
Some people say that there is no story in their time, just like the hands that are stretched out, nothing and nothing, only the monotony and repetition of mood and life; some people say that time is full of stories, like a sponge that absorbs water, Gently pinching, the past will flow into my heart, cold or warm, clean or turbid.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/IZmnXF993242cOn0R7Kf2.png?height=270&width=376)


Time is ticking, ticking by ticks, and going round and round, neither quicker nor slower for anyone. Some people say that time is passing, it flows forward without looking back, it does not stop because of beauty, and it does not retreat because of ups and downs; some people say that time is leaving, and what has been experienced is like the growth ring leaving traces in the heart, and it is also like shellfish. The stone sinks in the sea of â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹heart, either deliberately or inadvertently, and the memory of the past years is salvaged.
The second hand on the clock moves step by step, catching the pulse of time and keeping pace with time; like a heartbeat, it matches the pulse of the body and synchronizes with life. Some people feel that life is a competition, and the pursuit of everything is ahead; some people feel that they are left behind by time, and there is only one left to move forward. And time itself walks slowly and slowly, no matter how fast or slow it is.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Gk57bfDal9tGQFCy2vUAV.png?height=270&width=390)


Some people are passive and sluggish in time, and some people grow up actively in time; some stories have seen the end in time, and some stories have just started in time. And sometimes, what ends is also a new starting point, and the new starting point and occurrence also contain many past karma.
The second hand, minute hand and hour hand on the clock, the second hand is ticking, turning round and round, passing the minute hand and hour hand, every time it is the same, because the minute hand is still the minute hand, the hour hand is still the hour hand, the meaning represented It has not changed; however, each encounter is different because the time represented has changed.
Sometimes the encounter is a reunion after a long absence, and it is also an opportunity for change.
The second hand is ticking, like a person who is running around for life, constantly busy and repeating for study and work, people keep walking, day after day, in time, or actively enterprising, working hard for tomorrow; or numb, just Drift with time. In the rotation of day and night, people also study, read and work, and do some positive things, hoping to fill their empty garden of life, but in the passage of time, they will also feel troubled and confused.
Fortunately, in the turn of time, there is still a reunion and encounter. The second hand moves around in circles, growing up day by day. In the home of time, there are minute and hour hands that accompany it, just like its parents.
When the second hand and the minute hand meet, it has a feeling of coming home. The minute hand and the second hand are family affection at the beginning. The second hand is ticking, like a bouncing child. It grows day by day and grows up. On the way, there is closeness or distance with family, there is also the warmth that is integrated with family, and there is loneliness and bravery alone. Later, with the growth of the second hand, it has more emotional expectations, about friendship and love.
In the second hand's home, the hour hand is solemn and silent, but the hour hand's words also carry the most weight. Like a serious father, he is not like the minute hand. Every time he walks, he has a step response to himself. The hour hand and the minute hand meet, but the response of the hour to the minute hand is sometimes slow and silent.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ndogpCoHnKWE8Os8aA04w.png?height=266&width=474)


The response of the minute to the second hand, just like the mother's emotional response to the child, affects the child's own emotions, as well as the response and expectation of others' emotions later. The response of the hour to the minute hand, just like the father's response to the child's thinking and way of doing things, affects the development of the child's own thinking and ability to deal with things.
The second hand, minute hand, and hour hand are also like three kinds of people in the world, mortals, lovers and practitioners. Ordinary people are always moving, constantly changing in their own minds and the external environment, rushing through life, and rarely stopping for comfort and tranquility; there are lovers who wait for the opportunity to move, and have a little more nostalgia and calmness for the present, at the right time. Move to the next moment; practitioners, in the change, are not moving, not chasing, not stubborn, but more of composure and tranquility.
Everyone is a mortal, and mortals revolve in the world, walking day by day in the twilight of their own mind, day and night, and the development of world affairs.
Time has no temperature, but human hearts are warm and cold. When people's hearts can fall in love, or meet people who are in love with each other, mortals become affectionate people. Affection brings people together and walks together in time. People without affection and love are indifferent and numb, but those who are overly entangled in love and sinking are fiery and troubled, while those who practice cultivation seek stability and liberation in their hearts, and find cool water in their hearts. , balancing the fiery lust of desire.
The second hand, minute hand and hour hand are constantly rotating, different people are also rotating around different goals, ordinary people rotate for desire, fame, money, etc., some lovers rotate for love, affection, spirit, etc.; practitioners rotate for mind, wisdom, etc. .
Day and night rotate in the forward movement, and also move forward in the rotation. Tsangyang Gyatso said in his poem that turning mountains, waters and pagodas is not to cultivate the next life, but to meet you on the way.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-21h9HtioODcDgq9N6DN4.png?height=285&width=456)


When you have mountains and rivers in your heart, you will have a yearning for them. Small bridges and flowing water, and green hills outside buildings are people's longing. The more feelings of landscape, the less desert feeling in people's hearts; the more poetic in people's hearts, the more the meaning of landscapes.
If you have a Buddha in your heart, you will have a respectful heart towards the pagoda. You will cultivate and realize the Way, and you will be free from suffering and achieve happiness. This is what people yearn for. Heart. The more compassion of the Buddha in the heart, the less the heart to do evil; the more the wisdom of the Buddha in the heart, the less the heart of trouble.
What is in the heart, what is established, it will rotate and move forward, and on the way, only to meet you on the way.
Sometimes, the flowers haven't bloomed, not because they don't want to bloom, but because the time for them to bloom has not come; Time goes by frame by frame, which can shorten the distance between each other and make each other meet again.
Just like the second hand, the minute hand and the hour hand, the movement of time makes them separate, but in fact they are never separated, because the hearts are attached to each other and the hearts are together.
I can't see the time, but I can hear the ticking of the clock, I can see the rotation of day and night, and I can feel the change of seasons. Time just passes by, and what can be left is a person's own story.

London (CNN Business)If a recession were to arrive in the United States, there would normally be evidence of pain at America's biggest lenders. But so far, top banks aren't seeing major signs of weakness, even as they admit they're bracing for tougher times ahead.

**What's happening:** Results from JPMorgan Chase, Wells Fargo and Citigroup reveal that while Wall Street has been hit hard by the deep market slump, Main Street is humming along. Credit card spending still looks healthy. While banks are putting aside more money to cover bad loans, they aren't seeing significant problems yet.

"If you didn't look at anything else â€” you just looked at the bank numbers â€” you wouldn't be thinking there's a recession around the corner," Mark Conrad, a portfolio manager at Algebris Investments, told me.

title: Step back
body:
**Step back:** JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon freaked out investors last month when he predicted an [economic "hurricane"](https://edition.cnn.com/2022/06/01/economy/jamie-dimon-jpmorgan-chase-economy/index.html?utm_term=16581445297391121c0ac7e2d&utm_source=cnn_Before+the+Bell+Monday+7%2F18&utm_medium=email&bt_ee=vMGdSa1HkcT%2BmraHdNAoAYP1orbwCk6uWhzfW8Xe%2Ft9IcHDh70nm0QuEuKFPn2fr&bt_ts=1658144529742) caused by the war in Ukraine, rising inflation pressures and interest rate hikes from the Federal Reserve.

* 

A [plunge in dealmaking](https://edition.cnn.com/2022/06/30/investing/premarket-stocks-trading/index.html?utm_term=16581445297391121c0ac7e2d&utm_source=cnn_Before+the+Bell+Monday+7%2F18&utm_medium=email&bt_ee=vMGdSa1HkcT%2BmraHdNAoAYP1orbwCk6uWhzfW8Xe%2Ft9IcHDh70nm0QuEuKFPn2fr&bt_ts=1658144529742) has sharply reduced the amount of money investment bankers are bringing in after a blockbuster 2021. Investment banking revenue at JPMorgan fell 61% last quarter. At Morgan Stanley, it dipped 55%.

"That was expected to be a weak spot, and it was," Stephen Biggar, an analyst at Argus Research, told me. "They just didn't get many deals closed."

But elsewhere, activity looked solid. Credit and debit card spending is up 15% year-over-year, JPMorgan said. While consumers are shelling out much more money on gas, travel and dining still jumped a "robust" 34%.

* 

"You can see how resilient the consumer is in the US through the elevated payment rates and the low level of credit losses," Citi CEO Jane Fraser said on a call with analysts.

There's also still strong demand among companies for loans, even as executives say their [confidence is flagging](https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20220627005192/en/JPMorgan-Chase-Survey-Intensified-Challenges-Push-Business-Leaders%E2%80%99-Optimism-to-Record-Lows).

title: keep a peaceful heart
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/8DSXaRRiWss27d5esteVM.png?height=266&width=435)

Life is an endless sea, and a person is a small boat on the sea. When the sea is not calm, people are always happy and sad. When the nameless troubles hit, frustration and hesitation burn every nerve. But, friends, don't forget to keep a peaceful heart, and the pain will no longer be there.
In front of everyone, there is a road leading to the distance, rugged but full of hope. Not everyone can go far, because there are always people who are tired and give up halfway because they haven't dumped the sand in their shoes. Therefore, it is not the pleasure and pain themselves that dominate one's feelings, but the mood.
When the troubles of life strike, please drop the load, look up at the bright and blue sky, and let the gentle blue come into your heart. It's like when I was tired of playing as a child, I found a piece of green and soft grass to lie down, let the sun jump on my face, and let the breeze blow through my heart without wrinkles.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/dhgqDANSwgjKZPlzTVPXf.png?height=266&width=474)


When surrounded by layers of disappointment, please open the window, let the refreshing fresh air in, and find a trace of tranquility in the fragrant and sweet earthy smell, just like when you were a child, you picked up the dandelion whiskers, puffed up your cheeks and blew it open. Take another small umbrella, close your eyes with surprise, and make a wish. So, there is more comfort and joy in my heart.
When the helpless melancholy comes, please open your eyes, watch the sunset, and listen to the chirping of insects and birds. It's like listening to the crickets in a small courtyard when I was a child, and looking up at the twinkling stars in the sky. As a result, all the annoying noise gradually disappeared, and what was left was a peaceful heart.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/dJBLkV8DN-0y9N86IN4H7.png?height=286&width=460)


Keep a peaceful heart, and you will sigh sincerely: Even if I am not happy enough, don't frown deeply, life is short, why cultivate bitterness?
Keep a peaceful heart, and you will understand that broadness can dilute sorrow, and tranquility can dispel confusion. Yes, no one knows how far the distance is, but open the window of the soul and let the happy sunshine and moonlight pour in, and the peaceful heart will have a song of happiness that will never be extinguished.
By keeping a peaceful heart, you can continue to transcend and challenge yourself. Even if the distance is an eternal place, something will be born - a miracle.

title: Struggling Boeing pledges better times ahead
body:
### Struggling Boeing pledges better times ahead

Boeing is limping through a rough stretch that has damaged its stock and its reputation as one of America's mightiest corporate titans.

But as the Farnborough Airshow kicks off on Monday, Boeing's leadership struck an optimistic tone.

"I'm actually feeling pretty good about the moment," CEO Dave Calhoun told the [Financial Times](https://www.ft.com/content/a5735537-43af-4ddf-b119-7216b6000ccf). "The most difficult of our crises is being managed effectively."

**Remember:** The crashes of two of 737 Max jets that killed all 346 people on board the flights led to a crippling [20-month grounding](https://edition.cnn.com/2019/03/13/politics/donald-trump-boeing-faa/index.html) of the plane. It was one of the most expensive corporate blunders in history, costing Boeing in [excess of $20 billion](https://edition.cnn.com/2021/03/10/investing/boeing-costs-737-max-crisis/index.html). It's also been forced to delay deliveries of its wide-body [787 Dreamliner](https://edition.cnn.com/2021/07/13/business/boeing-787-dreamliner-faa/index.html) due to quality control issues and is pushing back the start of production for its 777X passenger jet.

The company said ahead of the airshow that it's "[very close](https://www.wsj.com/articles/boeing-closes-in-on-making-new-787-dreamliner-deliveries-11658084205)" to getting the approvals it needs to start Dreamliner deliveries again. It had about 115 of the planes in its inventory at the end of March.

Boeing announced Delta Air Lines ordered 100 of its 737 Max jets on Monday. It's the biggest order that Delta has placed with Boeing since 2011. Delta is the only major US airline that did not already own a 737 Max.

**Investor insight:** Boeing could use a win or two. Its shares are down almost 27% year-to-date, while stock in rival Airbus is just 7% lower.

body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/y8Wk5nkEqDPfhQ-mMuPmq.png?height=270&width=393)


The transparent stream is as clear as a mother's eyes.
In spring, your eyes are full of beauty;
In summer, your eyes are full of green;
In autumn, your eyes are full of clear blue;
In winter, you are tiredâ€”close your eyes and stop singing.
You take in the clouds in the blue sky, the sunset in the evening, the stars in the night sky; you also leave behind the shadow of my childhood.
Ah! The rustling sugar cane forest by the stream, and the sweet wind, once blew my childhood dream! I lay beside you, feeling the happiness of leaning against my mother's chest...
You are an old song in our lives -

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/dwPdhYcC65nKZA8N7v7EC.png?height=243&width=474)


You see the troop of donkeys coming, and a few suonas play sad music;
You see a few sturdy men coming with heavy wooden coffins and sending the old man up the hill;
You also heard: the unicycle at the foot of the mountain, with a creaking voice, moaning on the poor land...
Without you, who left us with natural colors;
Who recorded the sorrow and joy of the mountain people for us?
Transparent stream, you gave me a pair of eyes that can distinguish colors.
When I was with you and found myself a teenager, I had to travel far.
Like a mother who raised me, send me out of the mountain!
my feeling:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-BNwi0FewlqO_6ZwiNgjo.png?height=270&width=400)

The stream is a song, the mother is a song, and the article itself is a sad lyrical folk song. O stream, my "mother". Mother, like this stream. Mother. , you watched me grow up and took care of me meticulously. I miss the feeling of being with you when I am with you. I feel motherly love! Please forgive my naughty childhood, please forgive my ignorance when I was a child! All this, let me "make up" now. I love you my mother!

title: KFC is trying out a
body:
KFC is trying out a new type of [chicken](https://www.cnn.com/2021/12/05/health/roast-chicken-recipe-wellness/index.html) nugget in an effort to attract [younger consumers](https://www.cnn.com/2022/07/08/business-food/gen-z-restaurants/index.html).

Starting Monday, the chicken chain is offering Kentucky Fried Chicken Nuggets in restaurants in Charlotte, North Carolina, for a limited time. The nuggets are made with white meat and KFC's signature 11 herbs and spices, and they come in servings of eight, 12 or 36 pieces.

KFC already offers a few different types of chicken, including popcorn nuggets, on its menu. But it's betting nuggets will be a draw for the younger set.

* 

"We're targeting younger customers, like Gen Z and Millennials, who are interested in boneless chicken options," said a KFC spokesperson.

title: Home lending is
body:
Home lending is one exception. Wells Fargo reported 53% lower revenue from this business compared to the same period last year, while JPMorgan saw a 26% drop.

[Mortgage rates](https://edition.cnn.com/2022/07/14/homes/mortgage-rates-july-14/index.html?utm_term=16581445297391121c0ac7e2d&utm_source=cnn_Before+the+Bell+Monday+7%2F18&utm_medium=email&bt_ee=vMGdSa1HkcT%2BmraHdNAoAYP1orbwCk6uWhzfW8Xe%2Ft9IcHDh70nm0QuEuKFPn2fr&bt_ts=1658144529742) have surged as the Federal Reserve has aggressively raised its benchmark rate in a bid to cap soaring prices, eating into demand. The [Wall Street Journal](https://www.wsj.com/articles/fed-officials-preparing-to-lift-interest-rates-by-another-0-75-percentage-point-11658068201) is reporting that the Fed is likely to boost rates by three-quarters of a percentage point later this month, [lowering expectations](https://edition.cnn.com/2022/07/14/investing/premarket-stocks-trading/index.html?utm_term=16581445297391121c0ac7e2d&utm_source=cnn_Before+the+Bell+Monday+7%2F18&utm_medium=email&bt_ee=vMGdSa1HkcT%2BmraHdNAoAYP1orbwCk6uWhzfW8Xe%2Ft9IcHDh70nm0QuEuKFPn2fr&bt_ts=1658144529742) that it could pursue an even bigger increase.

Big picture: Broadly, the numbers look solid. Still, that doesn't mean a recession isn't possible. The mantra at banks right now is, "hope for the best, prepare for the worst."

"We know that if you have a recession, losses will go up," Dimon said. "We prepare for all that."

JPMorgan, Citi and Wells Fargo announced that they'd put aside billions of dollars to cover bad loans should they need to, while Citi and JPMorgan are pausing share buybacks to conserve cash.

**Coming up:** Bank of America's results and commentary from CEO Brian Moynihan will be watched closely to see if it keeps with the trend.

title: With the new order,
body:
With the new order, Delta's Boeing 737 fleet will expand to more than 300 total aircraft and will be its second-largest fleet family behind the Airbus A320.

Reuters separately reported a top-up order from Delta for around a dozen Airbus A220s is set to be signed as soon as Tuesday at the air show.

* 

Boeing faces a December deadline to win approval for the 737 MAX 10 - the largest member of its best-selling single-aisle airplane family. Otherwise, it must meet new cockpit alerting requirements under a 2020 law, unless Congress waives it.

Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun told Aviation Week in an interview published this month that the planemaker could be forced to cancel the 737 MAX 10 over potential regulatory issues. On Sunday, Boeing Commercial Airplanes CEO Stan Deal said that canceling the MAX 10 was "not a high probability path."

Delta said in the event of a delay in certification "the agreement has adequate protection in place, including allowing Delta to shift to another model of the MAX family if necessary."

* 

Delta had extensive discussions with Boeing before it agreed to the deal. "It took us a long time getting here," Delta senior vice president Mahendra Nair said, saying it had options if the MAX 10 does not move forward. "This is really the airplane that we would want and we would hope that Boeing can get the extension that they need for the certification."

The MAX 10 aircraft will be 20%-30% more fuel efficient than the retiring Delta planes it will replace.

title: Delta Air Lines will
body:
Delta Air Lines will buy 100 Boeing 737 MAX 10 jets worth about $13.5 billion at list prices and has options to buy another 30, the US carrier said on Monday.

Reuters reported in March that Delta was edging toward an order for 100 MAX 10 planes and reported last week that Airbus was in talks for Delta to expand an existing order of A220 planes.

Delta, which made the announcement at the Farnborough Airshow, said it would start taking MAX 10 deliveries in 2025. Delta previously was the only major US airline without a MAX in its fleet or on order. The MAX was grounded for 20 months after two fatal crashes killed 346 people. The grounding was lifted in November 2020 after software and training updates.

* 

"This is a huge testament to the value of the MAX," said Boeing senior vice president of commercial sales and marketing Ihssane Mounir at a signing event. "What an endorsement from a world-class airline."

* 

Boeing has had "strong demand" for the MAX since the ungrounding, with over 1,000 gross orders and 1.7 million flight hours, Boeing's Commercial Airplanes CEO Stan Deal said.

title: Creating buzz and selling snacks
body:
### Creating buzz and selling snacks

Among all consumer groups, competition in the fast food world is tight. One way for brands to stand out is to test new items and make changes to menus whenever possible, creating buzz along the way.

Earlier this year, KFC[ offered a plant-based fried chicken nugget alternative](https://www.cnn.com/2022/01/04/business/kfc-beyond-fried-chicken-launch/index.html) for a limited time. That launch "elevated the brand and boosted relevance," David Gibbs, CEO of KFC's parent company Yum Brands ([YUM](https://money.cnn.com/quote/quote.html?symb=YUM&source=story_quote_link)), said during a May call with analysts.

* 

The new nuggets have another potential advantage: They're perfect for snacking, a trend that's [seeing a comeback](https://www.cnn.com/2022/07/14/business/smaller-snacks/index.html) as consumers adapt to hybrid work or [return to the office](https://www.cnn.com/2022/07/13/success/hybrid-work-days-in-office/index.html). Nuggets could be a way for KFC to remind customers that they sell food that can be eaten on the go.

Other brands have also revamped their chicken lineups lately. Last year, Popeyes [launched its own nuggets ](https://www.cnn.com/2021/07/13/business/popeyes-chicken-nuggets/index.html)in an attempt to capitalize on the success of its [blockbuster chicken sandwich](https://www.cnn.com/2020/02/10/business/popeyes-chicken-sandwich/index.html). And earlier this year, McDonald's [brought chicken nuggets back](https://www.cnn.com/2022/04/05/business/mcdonalds-spicy-chicken-mcnuggets/index.html) to the menu at some of its locations for a limited time.

title: Gen Z, which includes
body:
Gen Z, which includes those currently between the ages of 18 and 24, is an important demographic for restaurants.

"The earlier you can engage with a consumer, the more potential you have for building loyalty and building frequency over the course of more years," Robert Byrne, director of consumer and industry insights at the restaurant consulting firm Technomic, [previously told CNN Business](https://www.cnn.com/2022/07/08/business-food/gen-z-restaurants/index.html). It's hard to develop loyalty "once somebody's past that window," he said.

But Gen Z is [less interested in dining out](https://www.cnn.com/2022/07/08/business-food/gen-z-restaurants/index.html) than other generations were at their age, making it even more important for restaurants to try to grab their attention.

title: a shining star
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/CsUCmBb-xxEJJYSvh8RTi.png?height=266&width=420)

A gust of autumn wind blew, the pool water rippling slightly, kissing the rocks lightly; the leaves fluttered and danced in the wind. Autumn came to us quietly again, with the warmth of summer but the slight chill of winter. I love seasons like this, brilliant and splendid, calm and calm, what a perfect synthesis!
This is the most beautiful night in autumn. I look up at the starry sky, the bright moon seems to be washed by water, it is extraordinarily bright, lofty and fascinated. The moonlight impregnates the whole earth, immersing the world in its silver sea of â€‹â€‹light, setting off a warm and quiet night, its beauty So captivating, its beauty is intoxicating!
But behind this beauty, there is the sadness of "the Qin Dynasty is bright and the moon is the Han Dynasty, and the people on the Long March have not returned", "people have joys and sorrows, the moon is cloudy and sunny, and this matter is difficult to complete". Looking at the bright moon, bowing your head and thinking of your hometownâ€ is the desolation and yearning of the bright and beautiful bright moon, how many tears and longings, how much pain and desolation are behind you!
In the vast universe, my heart is so lost, the bright moon in the sky once again reminds me of my long-lost relatives, I wonder if you can fly to that beautiful paradise as the myth says; I donâ€™t know the kindness Does the God of God exist, so that every good person can be reborn... But no matter what, there is always a me in the distance, in another world, always praying for you and blessing you!

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kol4SYBjfUzZ8kzBWTTiV.png?height=280&width=451)


I don't know how long it took, a cool breeze came, and suddenly I seemed to be awakened. I looked up at the starry sky again, and vaguely I saw the stars twinkling in the distance, just like a few poems "The street lights in the distance are bright, okay. Like countless stars shining. The stars in the sky appear, as if countless street lamps are lit... Heaven and earth are integrated, so beautiful and moving.
Look at the twinkling stars that dot the sky and decorate this dark night. The moonlight is beautiful tonight, but the stars are even more beautiful tonight. Its beauty is vast beauty, its beauty is selfless beauty, in every night, the twinkling stars always use their faint light to drive out the darkness of the night, in every place where the moon cannot be seen, that The faint starlight will also accompany you through the cold night.
When we are depressed, we might as well look up at the starry sky and the twinkling stars in the sky. It will not give you great strength and passion, but it will give you a touch of warmth, a touch of warmth that is enough to calm your heart.
Tears and thoughts, pain and desolation belong to the back of the bright moon, the twinkling stars will accompany me out of the night of the world, the winter of the world!
if there was a time machine
If there is a time machine, I will choose to go back to the past, go through the fog of time, and experience the Overlord of Western Chu.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/z9TK-Wk5ezDQmAxUyhGm6.png?height=266&width=424)


At night, a black song floats in the air - beleaguered from all sides.
Overlord, Overlord of Western Chu, I do not deny that you were once a mighty hero, but how could a hero have such an endgame today? The fate of heroes should not be like this! Maybe this is the fault of history. History is between you and the great ancestor, choosing to drown you in the long river of history! Maybe it's because you are headstrong and don't listen to people's advice!
You have created the historical glory of "breaking the boat and sinking the boat". In that Hongmen banquet, you couldn't bear to kill the killer. Today, it's your turn to face the sword of the emperor!
Hero wine, overlord heart, beauty tears. I know that you can't let go of Concubine Yu-your beloved woman; you can't let go of your Wuxian who was born and died with you, and you are even sorry for the Jiangdong elders who are looking forward to your triumphant return!

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/uuMMnd2uOtrOblgE8raJN.png?height=270&width=397)


The general trend is over, and you watch the people around you disappear little by little and fall down. You are powerless. There is no way, history is so cruel, no one can change history, no one can escape the fate that is doomed, when you see that all this is powerless to undo, is there something called "vicissitudes" in your heart?
Wujiang River.
This rolling river is like a glorious past that will never return, so you remember that since you dispatched troops, you have won more than 200 battles, big and small, and those victories show an unparalleled pride. , a beautiful night with Yu Ji - everything has become history, now you are facing countless enemy soldiers, you step back step by step, back to the riverside, back to the edge of history, Jiangdong fathers and elders appear in front of you Eyes of expectation - You stroked Wu Yan's head melancholy, then closed your eyes, and your heart turned abruptly, drew out your sword, and ended your life. A shining meteor just fell into the long river of history.
Live as a hero, die as a hero. So far, I have been thinking about Xiang Yu and refused to cross Jiangdong.
Postscript: This is how I met the Time Spirit and felt the helpless Overlord of Western Chu. I saw that the elves were crying. Because she felt the same as I did.
